40

column2: Administrator, Complaints & Compliance, Client Service Centr...
column7:
OVERVIEW:
JOB PURPOSE:

The Administrator, Complaints & Compliance is responsible for executing a variety of file management functions related to the processes in Complaints & Compliance, including providing administrative, professional and technical support to the Complaints & Compliance unit in the Client Service Centre. This includes opening and administration of complaints files as well as applications relating to by-law requirements, tracking and logging information in departmental file systems and databases, delegating files to Law Clerks, scanning documents, answering phone calls, and the development of a range of documentation and correspondence.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
A college diploma or equivalent.
1 to 3 years' administrative experience, with varied written communications responsibility, in support of a high volume, front line service department.
Excellent grasp of delivering superior client service.
Solid understanding of the Law Society, including organizational structure, services, and mandate.
Knowledge of the rules, regulations and guidelines of Complaints & Compliance, particularly requirements for case file history, documentation and correspondence.
Demonstrated organizational and administrative skills in order to prioritize activities and assignments, and to respond quickly and accurately.
Excellent attention to detail and time management skills.
Excellent interpersonal skills in order to establish and maintain productive working relationships.
Ability to plan and conduct on line and paper file historical searches across multiple databases.
Clear, concise and articulate communication skills to effectively respond to the needs of staff, internal clients, licensees, and the public.
Well developed written communication skills in order to develop a range of correspondence and documentation.
Proficiency in word processing (Microsoft Word), spreadsheets (Microsoft Excel), e-mail, the internet/intranet, database software (AS400), and other Law Society applications.
Strong typing skills, with the ability to type 60 error free words per minute.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Client Service Delivery

Provides administrative support to the Complaints & Compliance department related to the prioritization, development and processing of complaints, applications and inquiries.
Receives and sorts incoming mail, identifying and prioritizing correspondence, complaints, and applications.
Completes preliminary case file preparation, including historical searches and data entry requirements.
Answers routine telephone and written inquiries.
Forwards/delegates case files to Complaints & Compliance staff and Counsel, and prepares a range of documentation and correspondence on the direction of the Manager, Assistant Managers, Counsel and/or Law Clerks.
Forwards documents to other departments within the Law Society (including Intake & Resolution and Investigation Services) as required, and responds to internal and external inquiries related to the status of department files.
Tracks and logs case file information on Law Society databases.
Provides administrative support to the Complaints & Compliance department, including, but not limited to, ordering department supplies, documenting correspondence, scanning documents, preparing meeting minutes, and completion of filing and related activities, including managing the storage of closed files.
Provides back up to other Complaints & Compliance staff as required, particularly during cyclical periods of peak volumes of work.

Team Membership

Works effectively with other members of the Complaints & Compliance team.
Contributes to team processes, including prioritizing and coordinating work, exchanging information, and developing effective workflow processes.

WORKING ARRANGEMENT:
The Law Society has introduced a Distributed Workforce Model to leverage flexibility and agility, and to maximize employee productivity and engagement. Work arrangements will be determined by role and departmental requirements. The working arrangement for this position has been classified as hybrid, where the employee will regularly flex their work location between home and office. The specific application of this will be communicated to applicants contacted during the recruitment process.
ACCOMMODATION:
The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. We are committed to creating an accessible, barrier-free and inclusive workplace in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please make any requirement you may have for accommodation during the recruitment process known when contacted. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at hr@lso.ca or call 416-947-3438.

column2: Manager, Branch Operations and Data Strategy
column7:
Manager, Branch Operations and Data Strategy
Compliance and Registrant Regulations
Permanent, Full-time
File #22-91
Why join the Ontario Securities Commission?
Every day at the OSC is an opportunity to learn, innovate and grow professionally in a supportive, stimulating workplace
We offer a diverse, fair and flexible hybrid work environment and take pride in our challenging and rewarding work
As we believe in rewarding outstanding performance, we offer a highly attractive, competitive base salary, generous performance pay
Our Employees health is important to us, we have a highly sought after defined benefit pension plan and a comprehensive range of benefits programs with premiums paid by the OSC
The Compliance and Registrant Regulations Branch is currently looking for a Manager, Branch Operations and Data Strategy to join the team.
Reporting to the Director, Compliance and Registrant Regulation (CRR) and a member of the CRR Management Team, the Manager, Branch Operations and Data Strategy is responsible for providing strategic leadership and oversight for the planning, development and execution of the Registrant Financial Compliance Program, the $86M Capital Markets Participation Fee process, Technology and Data Analytics activities, Business Planning and Branch Reporting, and Risk Management for CRR.
In this role you will have the opportunity to:
Provide strategic leadership and oversight to the CRR Data Analytics Team and the CRR Financial Compliance Team
Lead the design and development of business intelligence, system and data analytics tools for the Branch Management team
Represent Compliance and Registrant Regulations branch on OSC and CSA IS data governance and systems development initiatives
Employ your sense of curiosity to understand and identify issues that may impact the branch/OSC reputation and recommend strategies to mitigate potential risks
Key Duties and Responsibilities
Registrant Financial Compliance Program
Leads CRR’s registrant financial compliance program that employs a risk-based approach to reviewing registrant financial statements and excess capital calculations, including remediation of breaches of regulatory requirements through various tools from terms and conditions on registration to suspension of registration
Establishes strategies and reports to monitor registrant solvency and profitability for both individual firms and the registrant population overall
Capital Markets Participation Fee process and all Fee-related matters
Leads the team that administers all aspects of registrant financial matters including the $86M in annual Capital Market participation revenue
Provides oversight for the desk review audit of participation fee collection
Responsible for the system of controls related to all revenue and fees and works with the Auditor General and Internal Audit to complete the annual testing of the branch’s Internal Controls over Financial Reporting (ICFR).
Provides expertise, advice and direction for responding to requests for fee waivers, refunds and re-calculations
Technology and Data Analytics Activities
Leads the strategic development and implementation of the Branch’s data analytics and process improvement strategy to facilitate evidenced-based decision making and streamline branch operations.
Documents and analyzes existing data sources, determines what new data elements/systems are required, implements data governance standards, creates searchable databases, determines data/reporting needs, develops business requirements, and implements new systems and tools. The division of responsibilities aligns with the hub and spoke model of the OSC’s Digital Solutions Branch (DSB)
Leads and collaborates with management and staff to assess current and future branch analytical and reporting needs, identify data issues and opportunities for more advanced, agile analytics and reporting. Ensures effective planning, development and delivery of tools, projects and initiatives.
Oversees the CRR “Helpdesk function”, consisting of investigating and responding to requests for assistance from OSC staff related to National Registration Database, RITS, MITS, OSCER and other databases or systems, received through the DataRequests mailbox.
Automates Branch processes that are repetitive, manual and labor intensive, with DSB Robotic Process Automation team. Monitor processes, following their automation, for effectiveness.
Monitors the quality of branch activities, identifying gaps, inconsistencies and trends.
Business Planning and Branch Reporting
Collaborates with CRR Branch Management Team to develop and execute business plans and strategies
Manages CRR Branch budget development and monitoring activities, identifies and validates budget requirements, prepares forecasts and projections and modernizes budget reporting.
CRR point person for audit and international standard setter reviews. Manages the audit process, develops management responses to audit findings, monitors and reports on remediation progress, resolving issues and influencing outcomes.
Risk Management
Develops and implements risk management strategies, developing and maintaining the CRR Risk Register and maintains linkages to the Enterprise Risk Management Framework
Relationship Management
Manages relationships with:
Ontario Registrants and International firms relying on an exemption – main point of escalation for any matters regarding Participation Fee process, Late fees, Financial Statement reviews and remediation of regulatory breaches, Capital Calculations and desk audits of firm revenues. Interacts with registrants to understand impacts of changes to fee policy or burden reduction initiatives in the context of many different firm business models. These factors impact 1,300 registrant firms and 1790 international firms.
Canadian and international regulators to share information around data strategy, fees, financial oversight program and industry trends
Federal government – Office of the Superintendent of Bankruptcy re access to Federal portal and information on Canadian bankruptcy statistics and trends
External Vendors – Mintz Global Screening re US Background checks (manage RFP process and ongoing contract administration)
Provincial Government – Ontario Shared Services – re Service Level Agreement for Collections Services – CRR implementation and ongoing oversight of the process for collecting Accounts Receivable amounts from registrants.
Represent the Director on various committees and working groups within the OSC, for example:
Systemic Risk Committee
Data Management Steering Committee
Risk Steering Committee
Staff Management
Manages the CRR Data Analytics Team and the CRR Financial Compliance Team, determining team goals and priorities, monitoring progress, productivity, work quality and adherence to policies and practice standards.
What you bring:
Designation/Certification: Chartered Professional Accountant holder (CPA) or equivalent.
10 years’ experience in an auditor or financial role in the financial services sector or in a regulatory environment.
Superior knowledge of data governance, data analytics, business process modeling, database/systems management, and use of data visual tools.
Experience using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Experience data modelling with, for example, SQL, R, or Python tools is an asset.
Minimum 3 years senior management experience, demonstrating strong leadership skills and the ability to manage people and budgets.
Strong leadership skills with experience building effective relationships; engaging with internal and external stakeholders; and working effectively under pressure (including handling change and dealing with competing priorities).
Financial management/budgeting skills. Project management disciplines or business process management preferred.
Relevant educational credentials are expected, for example: business administration, mathematics, statistics, computer / data science or the like.
Clear and concise verbal and written communication and problem solving and strategic thinking.
Grow your career and make a difference working at the OSC.
To explore this opportunity please apply by Friday, November 4, 2022 via email to crr@desautels.net . For more information contact Noel Desautels at (416) 888-7881.

The OSC is committed to diversity and providing an inclusive workplace. It is our priority to ensure employment opportunities are visible and barrier-free to all under-represented groups including but not limited to, Indigenous, Black and racialized groups, people with disabilities, women and people from the LGBTQ2S community, to achieve an employee demographic profile reflective of the demographic profile of Ontarians.
The OSC is a proud partner with the following organizations: BlackNorth Initiative, Canadian Centre for Diversity and Inclusion, and Pride at Work Canada
If you require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please let us know by contacting our confidential inbox HRRecruitment@osc.gov.on.ca. Visit Accessibility at the OSC to review the OSC’s policies on accessibility and accommodation in the workplace.

At Broadridge, we've built a culture where the highest goal is to empower others to accomplish more. If you’re passionate about developing your career, while helping others along the way, come join the Broadridge team.
Database Manager for Sybase, Greenplum, and DB2 implements the team’s strategy to provide excellence in the quality of service, accelerate the delivery of service, and reduce the cost and complexity of the database environments.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
The manager communicates the strategy to the team and ensures that the team is aligned to the long-term goals of the organization.
They are responsible for the team to deliver accurately and on-time delivery of database solutions.
They are well versed in the Sybase, DB2 and Greenplum database technologies and can provide technical guidance and leadership to the team.
They will be responsible to effectively manage the team’s workflow for projects, changes, and incident resolution.
The manager would need to be client focused and ensure that the team aligns to this core tenant. As data is the lifeline of our organization, we will be relying on the database manager to develop long-term strategies and database technology roadmaps to accomplish organizational, customer, and business objectives.
They assist in the formulation of a vision for the database team. Managers develop and implement team strategies, goals, standards, and policies.
They manage the coordination and prioritization of complex projects and act as a functional liaison between multiple clients, development, infrastructure, and business teams.
They provide oversight of the delivery of database services to all lines of Broadridge businesses and possess a broad functional, company, customer and industry knowledge.
Managers evaluate the overall cost of database solutions, products, and services – looking to provide best-in-class delivery at lowest possible cost.
They are responsible for performance management, staff development, and decisions regarding staffing, hiring, disciplinary actions, and other personnel decisions affecting the database team.
Additional:
Team player: intra- and inter-departmental cooperation that fosters morale and productivity.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Able to understand the impact of decisions on other disciplines.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent organizational skills and attention to details
A proactive, “service-first” attitude combined with ability to work independently on projects with tight deadlines and minimal supervision.
Basic Skill Level Requirements
Education:
Bachelor’s degree, college diploma or exceptional equivalent work experience
Related Database Certifications are considered an asset.
Experience:
8+ years of experience in architecture, design and implementation experience with Sybase, Greenplum, DB2 and different stages of the lifecycle (data model design, tuning and optimization, operational management and troubleshooting).
5+ years, leading database administration or engineering on large scale solutions
3+ experience managing a team, and successfully coaching and developing personnel
KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS:
Develop long-term strategies and technology roadmaps to accomplish organizational, customer, and business objectives.
Managers develop and implement organizational strategies, database-related goals, standards, and policies that are in alignment with company goals
They manage the coordination and prioritization of complex projects and act as a functional liaison between multiple clients, development, infrastructure, and various business units.
Manage multiple database related functions across multiple lines of business.
Oversee the delivery of database service activities.
Possess a broad functional, company, customer, and industry knowledge.
Establish and evaluate the overall cost of database related solutions, products, and services.
Responsible for performance management, staff development, and decisions regarding staffing, hiring, and disciplinary actions.
Recruitment Process
COVID-19 has accelerated change across our workplace, including our hiring practices. As a result, throughout your application process, you may be asked to connect with us virtually, and may not be required to meet in-person. Our recruiters will explain how virtual interviews will be held throughout the recruitment process, and they will be able to answer any questions you might have.
Workplace Flexibility
We are committed to supporting flexible work arrangements, investing in technology or other resources to enable you to work from home effectively, wherever possible.
At this time this is a hybrid role, and therefore you should have a basic home office set up, high-speed internet, and the ability to work without distractions during core business hours.
Accessibility & Accommodation
Broadridge is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace ensuring that equal employment opportunities are provided to all individuals, regardless of race, colour, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, creed, age, disability, religious affiliation, or national origin or citizenship. If you require any accommodations during the recruitment process, please notify our recruitment team.

About Queen's University

Queen’s University is the Canadian research intensive university with a transformative student learning experience. Here the employment experience is as diverse as it is interesting. We have opportunities in multiple areas of globally recognized research, faculty administration, engineering & construction, athletics & recreation, power generation, corporate shared services, and many more.
We are committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcome applications from individuals from equity seeking groups such as women, racialized/visible minorities, Indigenous/Aboriginal peoples, persons with a disability, persons who identify in the LGBTQ+ community and others who reflect the diversity of Canadian society.
Come work with us!
Job Summary
"
A Brief Overview
Reporting to the Associate Director, Development & Alumni Engagement in the Smith School of Business, the Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving is an experienced fundraising professional who is responsible for the implementation, management and growth of the Leadership Giving portfolio. The Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving will maintain an active portfolio of prospective donors in the giving range of $10,000 to $50,000, conducts 125 to 150 annual visits, completes 30 to 50 solicitations, and raises between $500,000 and $1,500,000 in philanthropic gifts on an annual basis. The incumbent develops and implements goals and strategies that increase philanthropic support from a variety of audiences by developing and nurturing relationships, and works with both annual and major gift colleagues in the team and across Queen's Advancement to enhance pipeline development and maximize charitable giving to meet the highest priorities of the school and Queen's. CFRE designation, or working towards this designation is an asset.
The schedule for this position requires the incumbent to work variable hours on a regular basis, including evenings and weekends. In addition, travel is an inherent part of the position. This position is subject to the Averaging and Travel Time Credit provisions of the USW Local 2010 Collective Agreement."
Job Description
" What you will do
Recommends, develops and implements communication and donor engagement strategies with various donor groups.

Supports senior staff on development decisions throughout the donor engagement lifecycle.

Identifies, evaluates, and recommend approaches to gaining or deepening relationships with current and prospective donors.

Develops objectives, discusses strategies for meeting objectives and executing annual plans, and resolves barriers to implementation.

Identifies, evaluates, and solicits prospective donors (individuals, corporations and foundations).

Creates and maintains print, email and web content to support departmental priorities.

Updates all contact and solicitation activity in the database.
Writes case statements and donor proposals in support of key solicitation/engagement opportunities.

Identifies, recruits, trains, and manages volunteers and coaches to assist with alumni communication, engagement and fundraising efforts.

Coordinates fundraising volunteer meetings, recognition, communication and engagement opportunities.

Collaborates with other Advancement staff to plan and facilitate development activities.

Other duties as required in support of the department and/or unit. Required Education
Four-Year Bachelor Degree or equivalent. In addition, requires trade certification, qualification, or on-going learning to remain ahead of changes in technology or emerging fields. Required Experience
More than 3 years and up to and including 5 years of experience.
Experience developing and/or implementing fundraising and/or major gift plans considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relationship building, fundraising and stewardship considered an asset. and

Experience in data, trend analysis and reporting considered an asset. and

Previous experience building relationships with donors considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, policies, standards and/or guidelines considered an asset. and

Experience in planning and/or managing projects considered an asset. and

Experience working at a post-secondary education institution considered an asset. and Consideration may be given to an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Job Knowledge and Requirements
Knowledge of concepts and principles in a specialist field that is typically acquired through a combination of advanced professional or academic qualifications and/or substantial work experience.
Provide effective consultation and advice on non-straightforward and/or complex issues.

Interaction with others requires interpersonal skills and the ability to understand and influence.

Adapt messages to meet the different needs of different audiences.

Builds relationships, trust and credibility.
Prioritize and distribute work to deliver objectives on time and to the highest standard.

Identify in advance when the intended results may not be achieved and develops a plan to address the gaps.

Actively participate in project team meetings and develop individual and unit project plans.

Lead procedural or technological change within a unit.
Identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of work processes.

Seek information and input to fully understand the cause of problems.

Appropriately assesses risks before making a decision.

Contribute to the creation and evaluation of possible solutions.

Take action to remove obstacles and address problems before the impact performance and results.
Apply equity, diversity, accessibility, inclusion and Indigenization considerations to decision making and planning.

Promote a work environment that is free from sexual violence, harassment and discrimination, and the ability to show empathy for those who have experienced trauma. "
Employment Equity and Accessibility Statement

The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal Peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. In accordance with Canadian Immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents.
The University provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources at hradmin@queensu.ca .

Want to make a difference in your career? Consider this opportunity!
Reporting to the Manager, Health Workforce Integration (HWI), the Lead, CRM, is responsible for leading HWI’s customer relationship management (CRM) platform, including leading end-to-end implementation of program reporting, dashboarding, team training and support, expanded platform development/functionality and maintaining health human resources data quality/integrity within the platform. The Lead is expected to oversee the daily use of the CRM platform and work closely with program staff to maintain the platform. The Lead provides all necessary guidance and support to ensure the CRM is optimized for the HWI programs and utilized appropriately, with a focus on quality and efficiency. The Lead supports the programs by developing and implementing solutions for improved program efficiency, consolidation of processes and advancing program priorities via the platform.
Here is what you will be doing:
Maintain up-to-date knowledge of leading CRM practices and technological solutions in the SalesForce environment to help improve operational efficiency and achieve program objectives
Lead all aspects of day-to-day CRM utilization, providing guidance and oversight on reporting, dashboarding, training and development.
Monitor and optimize health human resource data stored within the platform, including developing and implementing changes to improve data integrity/quality
Ensure the effectiveness of HWI programs by working with leadership to implement platform changes that will improve program operations
Provide day-to-day leadership to HWI team members on all matters related to the CRM platform, including identifying areas of concern and working with team members to resolve outstanding issues
Manage internal and external communications related to the platform on new process flows, platform updates and CRM expansion for new programs/initiatives including but not limited to urgent health workforce staffing initiatives such as the deployment of internationally educated health professionals or provider return of service programs.
Handle essential administrative functions including user account and system maintenance, reports and dashboards, workflows and other routine tasks
Lead urgent health workforce assessments through designing and leading HWI’s marketing and stakeholder communication solutions via the CRM platform.
Provide oversight and direction over HWI’s marketing and stakeholder communication solutions, leading program staff toward consistency and efficient use of the CRM platform.
Lead and support the evaluation, scope and completion of new initiatives implemented in the CRM related to new or existing programs to ensure HWI’s program data is captured and reported on accurately and in a timely manner.
Facilitate solution design after reviewing existing structure, and overall functional implementation on recommended approaches to CRM database structure.
Develop training materials and documentation for new staff and keep materials up to date. Train new staff on how best to utilize the CRM platform for their specific role, and provide ongoing oversight to ensure that staff are using the CRM platform accurately and effectively
Determine HWI program/operational requirements and translate these into platform solutions that achieve objectives and/or address key issues; implement and monitor/test the recommendations/solutions developed
Identify and escalate program/operational risks to the Manager; develop solutions to address the issues identified and take the lead on these changes
Here is what you will need to be successful:
Education and Experience
Completion of a bachelor’s degree in a relevant field; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
4-6 years’ of relative working experience combined with experience working as a “Certified CRM Administrator”
“Salesforce Administrator Certification” is strongly preferred
Proven experience in the delivery and execution of projects/programs
Deep knowledge of Customer Relationship Management platforms
Intermediate level of coding experience required
Experience working with Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Effective communications skills – deliver complex information to team members with varied levels of CRM experience
Attributes
Ability to quickly grasp operational requirements and translate to highly effective technical solutions, including support assessing impacts to service delivery.
Strong technical skills with the ability to respond to and support urgent program needs
Analytical skills to create effective reports and dashboards to meet program needs
Manage ambiguity, assess priorities to meet tight timelines
Ability to develop relationships with internal and external stakeholders to establish trust, credibility, and respect
Ability to analyze and define problems, evaluate alternatives, find solutions, and understand how and when to engage management to make a decision
Ability to provide innovative and creative solutions that will deliver value, quality, and high performance
Strong verbal and written communication skills to effectively present information to relevant stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Excellent organizational skills; responsible and highly motivated; must be able to manage multiple tasks, prioritize and effectively anticipate and respond to issues as they arise
Exceptional attention to detail
Ability to work in a collaborative team environment
Employment Type: Temporary Full time - 1 year contract
Paygrade and Zone: Grade 6 Zone A
Employment Location: Ontario (currently virtual; subject to change). All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.
Internal Application Deadline Date: Oct 11 2022
Ontario Health actively encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; Black and racialized; members of 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary; and disabled.
We encourage applicants with accessibility needs to notify us if they have any accommodation needs in the application and/or interview process.
Note: As part of the initial recruitment screening process, Applicants must confirm that they are Fully Vaccinated against COVID-19. If Applicants are not Fully Vaccinated, they will be asked to identify any accommodation needs pursuant to a protected ground under the Code. If no such accommodation is identified, the Applicant will not be eligible to proceed through the recruitment process.

Build a meaningful career
At LifeWorks, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 7,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.
LifeWorks can provide clarity among plan options and take the strain out of communications between members, administrators and fund managers. Our Ariel administration system is a robust recordkeeping platform that supports membership database updates, and provides electronic data interfaces, calculations and transactions.

The Client Manager, who reports to the Senior Client Manager and/or Director, Defined Contribution Pension Administration, will work within a team of 4 – 10 members that are composed of Analysts up to Directors that support 3 - 5 clients.
The successful candidate will oversee the day-to-day administration of all types of Employer CAP plans (including but not limited to GRSP, TFSA, Non-Registered Plans, RIF/LIFs, Share Purchase Plans, SERPs, and Notional Plans along with DC Pension Plans). Their focus will be on maintaining excellent client relationships, team training and development, process efficiency as well as ensuring audit and quality controls. We are seeking a creative, innovative and passionate leader!
Responsibilities:
Mentors the Associate Client Manager(s), overseeing their and their teams’ work and provides feedback and guidance on an on-going basis
Supports the Senior Client Manager and/or Director in the overall management and direction of the team
Builds excellent relationships with clients, through regular telephone contact and office visits. Helps the team to understand the client’s perspective and priorities and ensure they are always client focused and maintain client relationships
Coordinates and attends quarterly meetings for clients. Does other adhoc client meetings, reporting and presentations as required
Leads training sessions for the team and/or department to build knowledge on industry topics and trends. Trains and orients new team members on systems and procedures
Liaises with other teams and/or Client Managers. Devises ways to continuously improve team operations; identifies systems inefficiencies and implements appropriate plans of action
Analyzes project and work demands to ensure that resources are allocated appropriately amongst the team and that deliverables are being met
Takes the lead on client escalations and assists the team with proposing timely and cost-effective solutions
Participates in client implementations; tests new functionalities for existing applications and new applications; contributes to the documentation process
Participates on special projects as required including internal and external audits or administrative tasks
Requirements:
University or college degree or equivalent work experience
5+ years of Pension Administration experience, and is considered a DC Subject Matter Expert
3+ years managing clients and staff
Related courses in pension administration (ACAP) or group benefits (CEBS), an asset
Proven leader with the ability to motivate and inspire team members
Mentor and coach, who demonstrates patience and intuition
Extremely organized self-starter, flexible, highly independent
Exceptional customer focus with strong business and professional acumen
Excellent communication, project management, presentation and negotiation skills
Strong computer skills, particularly MS Word and Excel
Experience with pension administration software an asset
Fluency in French, both written and oral, is required
Where permitted by law, LifeWorks employees must be fully immunized to access a LifeWorks office or customer premises.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to
talentacquisitiononboarding@lifeworks.com
Fulfilling work that matters
LifeWorks is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve. We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.
At LifeWorks, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. We are excited to connect with you virtually, and look forward to receiving your application.

About Us:
Founded in 1957, AGF Management Limited is an independent and globally diverse asset management firm. AGF brings a disciplined approach to delivering excellence in investment management through its fundamental, quantitative, alternative and high-net-worth businesses. Our suite of diverse investment solutions extends globally to a wide range of clients, from individual investors and financial advisors to institutions, including pension plans, corporate plans, sovereign wealth funds, endowments and foundations. Our commitment to the principles of good stewardship and responsible investment is a positive differentiator for AGF. We believe integrating Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) issues into our investment decision-making and ownership practices across platforms will help deliver better investment outcomes to our clients.
About the Team:
The Retail Sales Department is responsible for servicing our advisors by providing value add solutions and an exceptional advisor experience. The team values innovation, leadership, and personal commitment. Our growth and success are the direct result of our employees' commitment and dedication, and our disciplined approach to investing.

About the Role:
You will build strong and lasting business relationships with our advisors by identifying, selling and cross-selling opportunities.

You are a great team player, and an energetic, motivated, and articulate sales professional. You are passionate about markets and excited to make an impact on AGF’s overall customer satisfaction. If this reflects you and your experience, join us and you will have the opportunity to build an exciting and evolving career.

Your Responsibilities:
Collaborate with the Regional Vice-President & Regional Sales Manager to increase sales and market share of AGF products, by conducting proactive outbound sales calls with new and existing advisors
Proactively, or when requested, provide support to dealers and brokers on the market and fund performance and management strategies, portfolio manager philosophies/styles/processes as well as portfolio profiles, value added programs, products and company updates, and industry trends
Support the Regional VP Sales and Regional Sales Manager by providing advisors and prospective advisors with product information and materials as required
Participate in AGF branch visits, advisor seminars, branch presentations, road shows, conferences and industry events
Conduct regional market research on organizations and people to identify emerging needs and new sales opportunities, sharing same with team members
Monitor sales activity within the territory to identify trends and provide suggestions to advisors in order to retain assets
Establish and maintain strong internal and external relationships to allow for the identification, optimization and realization of sales
Support the building of sales and advisor relationships through the booking of advisor meetings primarily for the Regional Vice-President Sales and for the Regional Sales Manager, as required
Effectively utilize provided sales tools including technology (CRM, Leads Module) to best achieve required business results
Keep abreast of changes in the market and incorporate that knowledge into conversations with advisors. Stay current with competition and effectively communicate advantages and opportunities when presented with competitive situations.
Maintain up to date advisor information in the CRM database
Ensure compliance and governance procedures are adhered to with respect to expense management and other regulated aspects of the job
Provide effective product and sales support to cultivate relationships and drive sales
As required, and approved by the Retail Vice-President Sales and District Vice-President participate in and/or lead advisor visits

Your Skills and Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in finance or a related field
Experience in the sales or finance industry
Knowledge of Salesforce.com a strong asset
Strong computer and phone skills, including Microsoft Office (word, excel, power point)
Developed presentation skills and telephone skills
Thorough knowledge of the securities industry and particularly of the stock and bond markets and how they relate to mutual funds
Ability create and maintain advisor relationships
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal
Excellent interpersonal, judgment & decision-making skills
Self-motivated and ability to be a great team player

Additional Strengths you may bring to the role:
Successful completion of IFIC and CSC or equivalent
#INDS
No unsolicited agency referrals please.

AGF is an equal opportunity employer. AGF welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request in all aspects of our recruitment and selection process. It is the Company's policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best qualified person for the job. AGF does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable legislation.
# R10710

OVERVIEW:
JOB PURPOSE:

The Administrative Assistant provides administrative assistance to a variety of personnel in the Regulatory Compliance Department, including document processing, handling internal and external customer needs and providing technical support and assistance to the department. The Administrative Assistant is also responsible for the monitoring of orders and undertakings. The Assistant ensures compliance by Licensees with orders and undertakings resulting from a regulatory process, and also compliance with a bankrupt Licensee's reporting obligations.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
A college diploma with a legal secretarial specialization, or equivalent training and / or experience.
A minimum of 3 years' progressive experience providing secretarial and administrative support in a confidential environment.
Knowledge of, or willingness to learn, regulatory division practices and procedures.
Solid knowledge of office practices, and legal terminology and legal documents.
Clear, concise and articulate communication skills to effectively respond to and transmit information to team members.
Proficiency in word processing, spreadsheet and database applications, internet and intranet.
Strong word processing or keyboarding skills, with the ability to type 60 error free words per minute.

KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Client / Customer Service Delivery

Monitors compliance of Licensees and former Licensees with the terms and conditions of orders, undertakings and bankruptcy reporting obligations.
Communicates with Licensees or former Licensees as required, initiates queries and assesses the response regarding issues of concern, tracks responses or failure to respond, and escalates the file as appropriate to other departments within the Law Society.
Obtains and reviews documents and other materials pertaining to compliance with orders, undertakings and By-Laws.
Prepares, forwards, and files legal and non-legal documents, and other documents with courts and other agencies.
Creates and maintains templates and forms to be used by the Regulatory Compliance Department, other Professional Regulation Division staff and Licensees or former Licensees.
Takes and prepares minutes of meetings. Transcribes electronic recordings.
Reviews and understands information in the Licensee database, in IRIS, in the Discipline History database, in undertakings, judgments, assignments of judgments, Hearing Panel and Appeal Panel orders, court orders and administrative orders as well as information regarding the status of any type of Licensee or former Licensee involved with the Regulatory Compliance Department.
Answers routine and complex inquiries regarding restrictions on Licensees’ professional businesses and discipline histories to internal and external customers in an accurate and timely manner, ensuring customer service standards are maintained.
Provides general administrative assistance and support to Regulatory Compliance Department staff including such requirements as typing, revising, and finalizing documents, photocopying, faxing, screening, and distributing mail, drafting routine correspondence, memoranda, and reports, opening and closing files, and readying closed files for storage.
Maintains electronic and paper files in accordance with established protocols.
Schedules appointments and meetings, ensuring room set up, required documents, and availability of attendees.
Assists Manager, Regulatory Compliance in preparing month end reports. Conducts bankruptcy and internet directory searches.
Maintains integrity of electronic files by timely keying of accurate, relevant information and follows up on same.

Performance Goals, Targets and Standards

Contributes to the development of standardized practices, guidelines and procedures in the appropriate conduct of Regulatory Compliance files.
Conducts own caseload, and works with other members of the department, as well as colleagues in Professional Regulation to establish, monitor and continuously improve process and case management performance targets.

Financial Responsibility

Maintains office supplies for assigned work area and orders supplies as required.
Ensures the efficient operation of all office equipment.
Compiles statistics and reconciles financial reports on a monthly basis.

Team Membership

Works closely with other members of the Regulatory Compliance Department as well as other Professional Regulation Division staff, to promote the sharing and transfer of knowledge and information amongst team members relating to Licensees, former Licensees and bankrupt Licensees.
Engages in problem solving with other staff members to continuously improve workflow and departmental effectiveness.

Special Projects and Initiatives

Assists Regulatory Compliance staff in the effective use of computerized support systems.
May undertake special projects as assigned from time to time.

WORKING ARRANGEMENT:
The Law Society has introduced a Distributed Workforce Model to leverage flexibility and agility, and to maximize employee productivity and engagement. Work arrangements will be determined by role and departmental requirements. The working arrangement for this position has been classified as hybrid, where the employee will regularly flex their work location between home and office. The specific application of this will be communicated to applicants contacted during the recruitment process.
ACCOMMODATION:
The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. We are committed to creating an accessible, barrier-free and inclusive workplace in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please make any requirement you may have for accommodation during the recruitment process known when contacted. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at hr@lso.ca or call 416-947-3438.

column2: Administration Manager, Intake & Resolution, Professional Re...
column7:
OVERVIEW:

JOB PURPOSE:

The Administration Manager, Intake & Resolution is responsible for managing, coordinating and supervising a team of Administrative Assistants within Intake & Resolution. As a member of the Department's management team, the Administration Manager is responsible for the overall administration of the Department's operations and projects. The Administration Manager monitors the performance of the administrative staff to ensure timely and accurate completion of assigned tasks and activities. The Administration Manager seeks out new methods for service delivery, focusing on continuous improvement of administrative processes and procedures in support of the Department's business plan.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:

A post-secondary degree with a specialization in legal administration, business or related field.
A paralegal license in good standing with the Law Society of Ontario* or a Law Clerk designation is preferred.
A minimum of 7 years’ working experience in a regulatory and/or legal environment providing senior administrative support and office management is required, 3 to 4 years of which includes para professional and supervisory experience in a law practice, government and/or regulatory environment.
Training and experience in communications and/or dispute resolution is essential.
Knowledge of law office practice and procedures is a strong asset.
A solid knowledge or office practice, legal terminology and procedure related to legal correspondence and legal documents.
Knowledge of the Law Society, including organizational structure, services, mandate, rules, regulations, and its By-laws and complaints process, in particular.
Knowledge of current trends and developments in the legal profession and their practical application.
Strong analytical skills to interpret and reason through complex information.
Commitment to delivering superior client service.
Knowledge of other legal resources and community based organizations.
Clear, concise and articulate verbal and written communication skills in order to compose correspondence, communicate detailed information and provide easy to understand explanations in an audience appropriate format.
Strong proficiency in word processing, spreadsheets, database applications, case management system, Internet and intranet, electronic search software.
By submitting your application for employment, you agree to a clearance check of your regulatory history with the Law Society, and to the use of this information in assessing suitability for employment at the Law Society.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Client / Customer Service Delivery

Supports the Intake & Resolution mandate to act in a timely, efficient and transparent manner in responding to complaints.
Reviews, evaluates and implements administrative procedures in conjunction with the Director, ensuring administrative staff workloads are balanced and effectively carried out.
Delegates and monitors the work assignments of assigned administrative staff, ensuring that results are timely and consistent.
Assists in the formulation of procedures and criteria for the screening and assignment of complaints, and in the resolution of process questions raised by complainants.
Communicates orally or in writing with Law Society staff, complainants, witnesses, members of the public and licensees regarding the regulatory process and the status or disposition of cases.
Drafts appropriate responses to inquiries to be sent directly or prepared in draft on behalf of Counsel or Officers.
Demonstrates excellent interpersonal and communication skills, showing compassion to complainants and licensees while maintaining regulatory excellence in responses.
Reviews files prior to transfer to other departments (including the Office of the Complaints Resolution Commissioner) to ensure that files are searchable, complete and adhere to the Law Society’s naming conventions.

People Leadership

Hires, trains, develops and evaluates employees accountable to the Administration Manager in accordance with the policies of the organization and best human resources practices.
Identifies technical and training needs of administrative support in order to achieve departmental and divisional goals.
Fosters a positive working environment by clarifying goals, building the commitment of individuals and working closely with the Director to resolve more complex and wider divisional issues.
Delegates work assignments to assigned support staff, matching skills and competencies to the requirements of the particular assignment.
Undertakes skill and competency assessments of assigned staff and develops a training plan to close any identified gaps.
Fosters a team environment by demonstrating leadership behavior and building team capacity.
Makes decisions regarding administrative staff development, performance, compensation and discipline.
Establishes, monitors and continuously improve work processes in both team and individual performance targets.

Performance Goals, Targets and Standards

Prepares departmental statistical reports and/or creates reports for use by department staff, Managers and the Director.
Works with Intake & Resolution team members, to establish, monitor and continuously improve work processes and both team and individual performance targets.

Financial Responsibility

Assists the Director in developing and monitoring the operating budget related to common expense items, as well as identified specific programs.
Assembles data and prepares periodic and special reports.
Requisitions supplies and materials and ensures the smooth operation of computer systems and equipment, arranging for maintenance and repair work as required.

Policy Development

Monitors issues and trends related to Intake & Resolution procedures and identifies and forwards issues to other designated Intake & Resolution staff in support of policy development or process change.
Provides input into the policy development process as required.

Team Membership

Works closely with Intake & Resolution team members and other staff, as assigned, to ensure the optimum utilization of the Administration Manager position.
Acts as a resource to the team to promote the sharing and transfer of knowledge and information between staff.
WORKING ARRANGEMENT:
The Law Society has introduced a Distributed Workforce Model to leverage flexibility and agility, and to maximize employee productivity and engagement. Work arrangements will be determined by role and departmental requirements. The working arrangement for this position has been classified as hybrid, where the employee will regularly flex their work location between home and office. The specific application of this will be communicated to applicants contacted during the recruitment process.

ACCOMMODATION:
The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at hr@lso.ca or call 416-947-3438.

Make your next move an expert one.
At Colliers it’s not our success that sets us apart, it’s how we achieve it. Our people are passionate, take ownership and always do what’s right for our clients, people and communities.
Why Colliers?
Our enterprising environment needs your expertise to facilitate Colliers’ continued growth as an industry leader. Our nimble, decentralized culture can provide you with a wealth of opportunities to learn about our business and quickly gain experience to accelerate your career.
Who you are
Reporting to the Sr. Director Data and Business Intelligence | Global, The Metadata manager will be responsible for developing and maintaining metadata information and developing Colliers Metadata management capabilities. This position will be a key SME on the meaning of data in the organization and the appropriate usage of data. It will work closely with regional and global experts including regional Metadata Managers, data architects and Digital Enablement teams. Over the long term this role will be instrumental in defining our Data Management and Governance approach and strategy
What you bring
Document, maintain and publish Metadata information through the appropriate channels and technologies
Reconcile and track Metadata information from multiple global sources to ensure similarities and differences between data from distinct areas of the organization are well understood
Drive the development/acquisition and implementation of technologies for Metadata management
Co-ordinate with Regional and Global Data SMEs to ensure there is effective communication and understanding of Metadata
Promote the usage of centralized Metadata management to ensure consistent understanding of Colliers data and long term Data Management strategy
Participate in the development and maintenance of an Enterprise Data Model
Co-ordinate with Global Web and Digital Teams in the usage and augmentation of Metadata information in data modeling and software development
Participate in the development of Use Cases which impact or contribute to the Enterprise Meta Data
Facilitate ad-hoc and scheduled training to variety of teams and individuals on the maintenance and usage of metadata

BA degree and relevant technical experience
5 years working in a mix of Data Governance, Metadata management, data Analysis or Business Architecture/Requirements roles
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of best practice metatdata initiatives, policy and techniques
Experience working in a new and evolving metadata practice
Experience with working with Metadata management in a structured platform such as Collibra or unstructured such as SharePoint
Experience with designing data relationship diagrams and business data or process models
Practical experience with Microsoft Office 365 suite of products.
Comfortable with basic database concepts and SQL Queries, Microsoft platform preferred.
What success looks like
You will successfully in developing and maintaining an effective Enterprise Data Catalog reflective of both Global and Regional terminologies and usage
You will effectively build additional and usage of the meta data model for both Global and ultimately regional systems
Drive the need to build an effective data discovery practice based on the Enterprise Data Catalog

Requisition ID: 162928

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Why work for Scotiabank?

Scotiabank is among the largest banks in the world and the most international bank in Canada. We are powered by our 97,000 high-performing teammates who make a real difference across the globe as a leading provider of advice, products, digital experiences, and financial services. Together with our Digital Factories around the world, we are dedicated to helping our 25 million customers become better-off.
This is a place where you’ll get to learn and develop your skills, while being recognized for your hard work. At Scotiabank, we’re passionate about bringing our whole selves to work, allowing us to create inclusive work environments for everyone to enjoy. Say hello to a career at Scotiabank!

Global Banking and Markets

Global Banking & Markets provides a full range of investment banking, credit and risk management products and services relevant to the financing and strategic development needs of our clients. Our products include debt and equity financing, mergers & acquisitions, corporate banking, institutional equity sales, trading and research, fixed income products, derivatives, energy, foreign exchange, and precious & metals. We also cross-sell the full range of wholesale products and services offered by the Scotiabank Group.

Purpose

Provide accurate information and processing support to NY Prime Brokerage by:
Receiving and validating information dividends/interests, claims, and reorg events assigned to Income processing (Stock dividends, stock splits, spin-offs etc) as well as DRIP and currency elections
Receiving, processing, and reconciling Reorg instructions within market deadlines
Verifying the dividend/rates, currency, tax implications with various depositories DTC, Clearstream, CDS, Citi, etc. and ensures that all entries are correctly processed, and Events are completely balanced.
Responding to inquiries from internal and external parties and ensures that all duties are performed in manner consistent with SCUSA's standard and procedures.
Verification/ approvals are required in certain circumstances.

Accountabilties

1. Ensures that accurate and timely processing of all cash dividends/interests/DRIP/Claims/Reorg by:
collect and research all information associated with dividend and interest payments (record date, payable date, tax status, etc.);
all claims (USD, CAD, and Foreign) are settled within specified time
reconcile and process distributions to client accounts accurately on a timely basis
process Optional Income transactions accurately on a timely basis
review and process depository elections with specified timeframes
respond to fluctuating volumes and maintaining a high degree of accuracy
review reports from both external and internal sources daily DTC, CDS, CLEARSTREAM, CITI, BLOOMSBERG, ANVIL etc and take the necessary action required

2. Ensures that the payments are reconciled and instructions are acted upon
solve problems of an unusual nature including identifying the cause of the problem and what is required to prevent a recurrence
take instructions and settle incoming and outgoing claims with other institutions
claim other institutions for payments resulting from fail trades and lending positions
review for discrepancies within BFS system and investigate
reconcile payments with all Depositories Custodians and control account

3. Provide ongoing assistance to the Department Manager
provide technical expertise and specialized assistance relative to Income Processing
follow escalation procedures for any potential losses
reconcile unclaimed dividend accounts on a daily basis
reconcile credit balances and provide detailed backup on outstanding amounts
train and cross-train other department staff members
provide support on other desks in the department as required by holiday schedules, volumes and projects.

4. Responding to inquiries from other departments and branches globally and providing customer service in accordance with GWO’s policies and procedures.
Liaise with various departments, depositories and external contacts to resolve a variety of problems

Requirements

2+ years of Corporate Action experience required. Industry background and knowledge of security operations. Sound knowledge of Corporate Action processing (Mandatory & Voluntary), stock borrows/ loans transactions and liabilities, Income processing and various market entitlements compensations (Trade date vs settlement date market).
2+ years of experience dealing with operational procedures and conventions of the various depositories/transfer agents the area interacts with - CDS, DTC, Clearstream, HSBC, BNP Paribas, Citibank and various transfer agents, law firms and companies
2+ years of experience / good operating knowledge of the ADP system in general, a detailed knowledge of the ADP REOR system and good PC skills (Word, Excel, Access Database) Internet, Email, Bloomberg, CDS system, DTC, GLOSS etc
Effective communication skills both verbal and written. Ability to read, analyze and interpret for a wide audience very complex legal forms, documents and materials.
Strong industry background and knowledge of security operations in order to assist in the training of new personnel and lend support to co-workers when advice and/or instruction is required.
Self-starter that actively engages issues seeking resolution, ability to meet dynamic changes on prioritization
Fast, adaptable learner who can hit the ground running
Ability to work well under pressure while demonstrating strong professionalism
Strong investigation, prioritization, and organization skills
Candidate must have an open mind when it comes to approach, and be able to assess each situation separately

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

column2: Manager, Data Analysis & Engineering, Global Banking and Mar...
column7:
Requisition ID: 162578

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

The Manager, Data Analysis & Engineering role is a part of the Client Insights and Analytics team. The group supports Global Banking and Markets in providing oversight and executing strategic initiatives across all divisions of Global Banking and Markets. This team is responsible for driving the analytics to drive client profitability, sales effectiveness and segmentation. This team is responsible for identifying business opportunities through the use of analytics to drive revenue growth.

This role supports the analysis and strategy functions of Global Banking and Markets using Client MIS data. The incumbent will be heavily involved with data extraction, manipulation, mapping, query & database design, and must be capable of developing new tools and analysis to support the needs of GBM and GBM Executives. This role contributes to the overall success of Global Banking and Markets by providing reporting and insight necessary for evaluation and decision-making purposes.

Is this role right for you?
Develop Reporting - Develop meaningful performance and financial reporting; clearly communicate findings.
Data Flow Design and Development – Design and create processes that enable reporting and automation.
Develop Models and Tools - Build, as required, new analytics, reporting models, and tools.
Monthly and Quarterly Reporting - Production, testing, and validation of monthly/quarterly reporting.
Perform Analysis - Perform quantitative and qualitative analysis, interpret results.
Logic and Algorithm Design - Review, maintain, and develop the algorithms implemented in current tools and processes.
Conduct Research - Research and implement best practices for analysis and reporting.
Ad Hoc Requests - Support ad hoc requests from Executive Management, auditors, regulators, ratings agencies, research analysts and other external parties as required.
Team Environment - Contribute to an environment in which the team works together to produce creative and value-added strategic analyses while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to, and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls.

Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role? We'd love to work with you if you have:
Undergraduate degree in economics/math/computer science.
2+ years of relevant work experience in capital markets, finance, IT, reporting, or analytics.
Strong analytical and investigative skills with proven ability to interpret data, spot patterns and anomalies, and provide insight.
Strong creativity: be able to solve difficult problems with innovative or unconventional techniques when standard approaches fail.
Excellent oral and written communication and presentation skills.
Results-driven and able to grasp and communicate complex ideas clearly.
Comfortable working with all levels of management across the organization.
Extensive understanding of data and experience with working with multi-million row datasets.
Knowledge of algorithm design is a plus.
Experienced with Excel (VBA custom functions, Pivot tables, nested formulas, charting), PowerPoint, data mining, and reporting with Tableau/Power BI.
Expert knowledge of SQL and Python; have experience developing applications.
Strong understanding of and practical experience with modern entity resolution techniques.
Self-starter and demonstrated high level of sustained initiative, ability to apply strategic critical thinking to business issues and drive results.

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Kotn, we’re reimagining the way our everyday items are made and purchased, beginning with your wardrobe, setting a new standard for social impact and traceability. Founded in February 2015, Kotn has been featured in over 80 publications such as New York Times, GQ, Vogue, Elle, and The Wall St. Journal. Kotn was founded in Toronto by three best friends, who were sick of compromising on quality, design, sustainability, brand experience, and price.
Kotn is looking for a driven and entrepreneurial Business Development Representative to join our team! You will be responsible for sourcing, prospecting, and qualifying outbound sales opportunities for Kotn’s custom branded division of the company, Kotn Supply. As an integral member of our sales team and first BDR, you will work closely with an Account Executive to grow Kotn Supply’s new business via outbound sales to achieve our lofty sales goals, and will be a foundational member of our team and contribute heavily to a sales playbook that is in its infancy. This is an opportunity to really leave your mark on a new company with ambitious growth goals!
What you’ll be working on:
Production Operations (50%)
Coordinate the production of all domestic wholesale orders from warehouse to decorator to client
Work with 3rd party product vendors to create purchase orders on behalf of clients
Partner with L&D to manage the shipping of all wholesale orders via couriers
Support Sales team with creating and shipping sample orders
Facilitate inventory reservations via Shopify to satisfy client needs in advance
Develop and maintain SOPs for all wholesale production functions, always seeking new and innovative ways to improve and grow this function of the business.
Assist the General Manager in creating purchase orders for ordering additional inventory through Kotn’s supply chain in Egypt
Quality Control (25%)
Ensure accuracy, on time deliveries and consistent costing from suppliers
Work closely with Account Managers to communicate key order information, presenting solutions if any issues arise
Maintain CRM and production database, ensuring all information (costs, products, etc.) are up-to-date and accurate
Customer Relations (25%)
Work closely with clients to communicate project status, shipping dates, invoices and any other information pertinent to their order status.
Follow up after deliveries to ensure satisfaction and provide an exceptional experience
What you’ll bring:
Excellent Organizational and Communications Skills
Can manage many deadlines and projects keeping them all organized and statuses clearly communicated to all parties needed.
Thorough and meticulous
Committed to ensuring accuracy across the organization and with external partners so that the customer is delivered an exceptional experience and quality product.
Multitasking
The ability to manage multiple projects and timelines while effectively communicating to internal and external stakeholders. You don’t get overwhelmed easily, and find creative ways to manage many projects at once.
Additional Requirements:
2+ years in a operations and/or production support role
Exceptional communication skills to ensure accuracy of information
Incredibly organized and able to manage multiple moving pieces at once
Committed to continuous improvement and can spot opportunities for optimization and implement solutions independently
Alignment with the company’s ethos is considered a requirement for this role. You’re passionate about ethical and sustainable fashion.

Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving

About Queen's University
Queen’s University is the Canadian research intensive university with a transformative student learning experience. Here the employment experience is as diverse as it is interesting. We have opportunities in multiple areas of globally recognized research, faculty administration, engineering & construction, athletics & recreation, power generation, corporate shared services, and many more.
We are committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcome applications from individuals from equity seeking groups such as women, racialized/visible minorities, Indigenous/Aboriginal peoples, persons with a disability, persons who identify in the LGBTQ+ community and others who reflect the diversity of Canadian society.
Come work with us!



Job Summary
"
A Brief Overview
Reporting to the Associate Director, Development & Alumni Engagement in the Smith School of Business, the Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving is an experienced fundraising professional who is responsible for the implementation, management and growth of the Leadership Giving portfolio. The Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving will maintain an active portfolio of prospective donors in the giving range of $10,000 to $50,000, conducts 125 to 150 annual visits, completes 30 to 50 solicitations, and raises between $500,000 and $1,500,000 in philanthropic gifts on an annual basis. The incumbent develops and implements goals and strategies that increase philanthropic support from a variety of audiences by developing and nurturing relationships, and works with both annual and major gift colleagues in the team and across Queen's Advancement to enhance pipeline development and maximize charitable giving to meet the highest priorities of the school and Queen's. CFRE designation, or working towards this designation is an asset.
The schedule for this position requires the incumbent to work variable hours on a regular basis, including evenings and weekends. In addition, travel is an inherent part of the position. This position is subject to the Averaging and Travel Time Credit provisions of the USW Local 2010 Collective Agreement."

Job Description
" What you will do
Recommends, develops and implements communication and donor engagement strategies with various donor groups.
Supports senior staff on development decisions throughout the donor engagement lifecycle.
Identifies, evaluates, and recommend approaches to gaining or deepening relationships with current and prospective donors.
Develops objectives, discusses strategies for meeting objectives and executing annual plans, and resolves barriers to implementation.
Identifies, evaluates, and solicits prospective donors (individuals, corporations and foundations).
Creates and maintains print, email and web content to support departmental priorities.
Updates all contact and solicitation activity in the database.
Writes case statements and donor proposals in support of key solicitation/engagement opportunities.

Identifies, recruits, trains, and manages volunteers and coaches to assist with alumni communication, engagement and fundraising efforts.
Coordinates fundraising volunteer meetings, recognition, communication and engagement opportunities.

Collaborates with other Advancement staff to plan and facilitate development activities.
Other duties as required in support of the department and/or unit.
Required Education
Four-Year Bachelor Degree or equivalent. In addition, requires trade certification, qualification, or on-going learning to remain ahead of changes in technology or emerging fields.
Required Experience
More than 3 years and up to and including 5 years of experience.
Experience developing and/or implementing fundraising and/or major gift plans considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relationship building, fundraising and stewardship considered an asset. and

Experience in data, trend analysis and reporting considered an asset. and

Previous experience building relationships with donors considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, policies, standards and/or guidelines considered an asset. and

Experience in planning and/or managing projects considered an asset. and

Experience working at a post-secondary education institution considered an asset. and
Consideration may be given to an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Job Knowledge and Requirements
Knowledge of concepts and principles in a specialist field that is typically acquired through a combination of advanced professional or academic qualifications and/or substantial work experience.
Provide effective consultation and advice on non-straightforward and/or complex issues.

Interaction with others requires interpersonal skills and the ability to understand and influence.

Adapt messages to meet the different needs of different audiences.

Builds relationships, trust and credibility.
Prioritize and distribute work to deliver objectives on time and to the highest standard.

Identify in advance when the intended results may not be achieved and develops a plan to address the gaps.

Actively participate in project team meetings and develop individual and unit project plans.

Lead procedural or technological change within a unit.
Identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of work processes.

Seek information and input to fully understand the cause of problems.

Appropriately assesses risks before making a decision.

Contribute to the creation and evaluation of possible solutions.

Take action to remove obstacles and address problems before the impact performance and results.
Apply equity, diversity, accessibility, inclusion and Indigenization considerations to decision making and planning.

Promote a work environment that is free from sexual violence, harassment and discrimination, and the ability to show empathy for those who have experienced trauma.
"

Employment Equity and Accessibility Statement
The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal Peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. In accordance with Canadian Immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents.
The University provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources at hradmin@queensu.ca.
