column2: Legal Administrative Assistant, Litigation Services, Profess...
column7:
OVERVIEW:
JOB PURPOSE:

As part of the Litigation Services Department, the Legal Administrative Assistant (“the Assistant”) plans, organizes and coordinates administrative practices and procedures, ensuring ongoing case management while handling multiple and competing deadlines relating to internal complaint processes, regulatory and/or court proceedings. The Assistant may support hearings and appeals before the Law Society Tribunal. Because Litigation Services files often deal with political and media sensitive issues, subject to full public scrutiny, the Legal Administrative Assistant needs to exercise a high degree of judgment.

QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:
A college diploma with a legal administration specialization, or equivalent training and / or experience.
3 to 5 years’ working experience providing legal administrative support in a confidential, legal or professional regulatory environment (preferably litigation).
A solid knowledge of legal office practice, legal terminology and procedure relating to legal correspondence and legal documents.
Clear, concise and articulate communication skills to effectively respond to and transmit information to team members and others.
The ability to communicate in French, verbally and written would be an asset.
A strong proficiency with a wide range of computer applications, including MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook), database applications, case management systems, Internet and Intranet and other software applications (Adobe Acrobat DC, SharePoint and ShareFile).
for Licensed Paralegals: by submitting your application for employment, you agree to a clearance check of your regulatory history with the Law Society, and to the use of this information in assessing suitability for employment at the Law Society.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Client / Customer Service Delivery

As a member of the Litigation Services Department, the Assistant provides exceptional administrative assistance and support to their team. This includes opening files, typing, drafting, proofreading, photocopying, faxing, binding documents, scanning, screening and distributing mail, revising and formatting various correspondence and legal documents, typing transcripts of digitally recorded interviews of licensees and witnesses, issuing and arranging for service of originating processes and other documents in accordance with the Law Society’s Rules of Practice and Procedure and the Rules of Civil Procedure, liaising with witnesses, closing files and preparing materials for storage.
Preparing and filing materials with the Tribunal Office and the Courts in respect of hearings, motions and appeals in accordance with the Law Society’s Rules of Practice and Procedure and the Rules of Civil Procedure, with associated deadlines.
Regularly drafting or preparing affidavits, charts, correspondence and memoranda.
Regularly preparing and organizing books of authorities, document books, facta, materials to be filed as exhibits in hearings and hearing briefs for counsel and paralegal’s review.
Redacting documents for filing at hearings to eliminate/protect confidential or identifying information.
Coordinating and requesting the services of process servers to serve materials on licensees, applicants and witnesses.
Preparing summonses to witnesses and contacting witnesses regarding their availability and coordinating travel arrangements and/or virtual hearing appearances.
Ensuring the accurate and timely maintenance of the case management requirements of the Litigation Services processes.
Uploading various Tribunal and Court documents to the Discipline History Database.
Preparing summary sheets outlining details of regulatory proceedings and appeals.
Maintaining electronic and paper files in accordance with established protocols.
Scheduling appointments and meetings, ensuring room set up, required documents, and availability of attendees, and arranging for language interpreters as required.
Assisting the Administrative Manager and assigned team by reviewing reports to ensure the case management system is up to date.
Coordinating travel arrangements as requested for staff and witnesses.
Supporting various regulatory processes by performing searches, including CanLII, motor vehicle and internet directory searches.
Ordering transcripts from court reporters who transcribed Law Society proceedings and from various court offices.
Calling or attending court offices to obtain documents or information concerning ongoing investigations, regulatory proceedings and/or appeals from disciplinary proceedings, as required.
Answering inquiries from Law Society staff, witnesses, complainants and licensees and following up on same ensuring excellent customer service standards are maintained. Maintains strict confidentiality of information at all times.

Financial Responsibility

Maintains office supplies for assigned work area and orders supplies as required. Ensures the efficient operation of all office equipment.
Prepares expense reports, cheque requisitions and processes invoices as received for payment. Compiles statistics and special reports as assigned.

Team Membership

Promotes the sharing and transfer of knowledge and expertise amongst other team members and those they work closely together with and is a dedicated and proactive member of the administrative team.
Works closely with other members of the administrative support team to ensure effective utilization of division resources.
Engages in problem solving with other team members to continuously improve workflow and departmental effectiveness.
Must be proactive when working with their teams at times taking the lead to ensure that timelines are met.
Act as a liaison for staff with internal and external clients.

Performance Goals, Targets and Standards

Meets established individual targets, including quality and time standards.
Identifies gaps in the department’s work processes and procedures, bringing them to the attention of the Administration Manager.
Manages and participates in developing solutions to optimize both individual and departmental performance and goals.

Special Projects and Initiatives

Assists Litigation Services staff in the effective use of computerized support systems.
May undertake special projects as assigned from time to time.
Working with the Administration Manager to assist in performance improvements for the administrative support team (work process, procedures and service standards). Makes suggestions for workflow and process improvements.
WORKING ARRANGEMENT:
The Law Society has introduced a Distributed Workforce Model to leverage flexibility and agility, and to maximize employee productivity and engagement. Work arrangements will be determined by role and departmental requirements. The working arrangement for this position has been classified as hybrid, where the employee will regularly flex their work location between home and office. The specific application of this will be communicated to applicants contacted during the recruitment process.
ACCOMMODATION:
The Law Society of Ontario values and respects diversity. We are committed to creating an accessible, barrier-free and inclusive workplace in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Please make any requirement you may have for accommodation during the recruitment process known when contacted. If you are unable to apply to this position due to the requirement for an accommodation of any kind, please email us at hr@lso.ca or call 416 947-3475.

Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving

About Queen's University
Queen’s University is the Canadian research intensive university with a transformative student learning experience. Here the employment experience is as diverse as it is interesting. We have opportunities in multiple areas of globally recognized research, faculty administration, engineering & construction, athletics & recreation, power generation, corporate shared services, and many more.
We are committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcome applications from individuals from equity seeking groups such as women, racialized/visible minorities, Indigenous/Aboriginal peoples, persons with a disability, persons who identify in the LGBTQ+ community and others who reflect the diversity of Canadian society.
Come work with us!



Job Summary
"
A Brief Overview
Reporting to the Associate Director, Development & Alumni Engagement in the Smith School of Business, the Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving is an experienced fundraising professional who is responsible for the implementation, management and growth of the Leadership Giving portfolio. The Relationship Manager, Leadership Giving will maintain an active portfolio of prospective donors in the giving range of $10,000 to $50,000, conducts 125 to 150 annual visits, completes 30 to 50 solicitations, and raises between $500,000 and $1,500,000 in philanthropic gifts on an annual basis. The incumbent develops and implements goals and strategies that increase philanthropic support from a variety of audiences by developing and nurturing relationships, and works with both annual and major gift colleagues in the team and across Queen's Advancement to enhance pipeline development and maximize charitable giving to meet the highest priorities of the school and Queen's. CFRE designation, or working towards this designation is an asset.
The schedule for this position requires the incumbent to work variable hours on a regular basis, including evenings and weekends. In addition, travel is an inherent part of the position. This position is subject to the Averaging and Travel Time Credit provisions of the USW Local 2010 Collective Agreement."

Job Description
" What you will do
Recommends, develops and implements communication and donor engagement strategies with various donor groups.
Supports senior staff on development decisions throughout the donor engagement lifecycle.
Identifies, evaluates, and recommend approaches to gaining or deepening relationships with current and prospective donors.
Develops objectives, discusses strategies for meeting objectives and executing annual plans, and resolves barriers to implementation.
Identifies, evaluates, and solicits prospective donors (individuals, corporations and foundations).
Creates and maintains print, email and web content to support departmental priorities.
Updates all contact and solicitation activity in the database.
Writes case statements and donor proposals in support of key solicitation/engagement opportunities.

Identifies, recruits, trains, and manages volunteers and coaches to assist with alumni communication, engagement and fundraising efforts.
Coordinates fundraising volunteer meetings, recognition, communication and engagement opportunities.

Collaborates with other Advancement staff to plan and facilitate development activities.
Other duties as required in support of the department and/or unit.
Required Education
Four-Year Bachelor Degree or equivalent. In addition, requires trade certification, qualification, or on-going learning to remain ahead of changes in technology or emerging fields.
Required Experience
More than 3 years and up to and including 5 years of experience.
Experience developing and/or implementing fundraising and/or major gift plans considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relationship building, fundraising and stewardship considered an asset. and

Experience in data, trend analysis and reporting considered an asset. and

Previous experience building relationships with donors considered an asset. and

Knowledge of relevant laws, regulations, policies, standards and/or guidelines considered an asset. and

Experience in planning and/or managing projects considered an asset. and

Experience working at a post-secondary education institution considered an asset. and
Consideration may be given to an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Job Knowledge and Requirements
Knowledge of concepts and principles in a specialist field that is typically acquired through a combination of advanced professional or academic qualifications and/or substantial work experience.
Provide effective consultation and advice on non-straightforward and/or complex issues.

Interaction with others requires interpersonal skills and the ability to understand and influence.

Adapt messages to meet the different needs of different audiences.

Builds relationships, trust and credibility.
Prioritize and distribute work to deliver objectives on time and to the highest standard.

Identify in advance when the intended results may not be achieved and develops a plan to address the gaps.

Actively participate in project team meetings and develop individual and unit project plans.

Lead procedural or technological change within a unit.
Identify opportunities to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of work processes.

Seek information and input to fully understand the cause of problems.

Appropriately assesses risks before making a decision.

Contribute to the creation and evaluation of possible solutions.

Take action to remove obstacles and address problems before the impact performance and results.
Apply equity, diversity, accessibility, inclusion and Indigenization considerations to decision making and planning.

Promote a work environment that is free from sexual violence, harassment and discrimination, and the ability to show empathy for those who have experienced trauma.
"

Employment Equity and Accessibility Statement
The University invites applications from all qualified individuals. Queen’s is committed to employment equity and diversity in the workplace and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, Aboriginal Peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity. In accordance with Canadian Immigration requirements, priority will be given to Canadian citizens and permanent residents.
The University provides support in its recruitment processes to applicants with disabilities, including accommodation that takes into account an applicant's accessibility needs. Candidates requiring accommodation during the recruitment process are asked to contact Human Resources at hradmin@queensu.ca.

column2: Manager, EV Charging Deployment - Canadian Tire Corporation
column7:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
As a leader in the automotive channel (parts/tires/service) CTC's strategic direction for automotive is to ensure we remain relevant with the automotive customer. the landscape of car ownership and mobility is rapidly changing. Electric Vehicle adoption is ramping as customers are choosing to move from a hydrocarbon / fossil fuel mobility to one that is more sustainable and friendly to the environment. CTC automotive is well positioned to capture that new channel. This role contributes directly to CTC’s goal of making life in Canada better by filling in a major gap in the adoption of Battery Electric vehicles. CTC’s strategy to deploy a EV charging stations across the country will help alleviate range anxiety with EV drivers (number one concern).
The primary responsibility of this role is to evaluate EV charging sites to determine feasibility, work with internal/external stakeholders (Canadian Tire Real Estate, Dealers, Electric Vehicle (EV) partners and local utilities) to develop preliminary site plans, and define electrical capacity requirements. Additionally, the EV Infrastructure Manager will project manage CTC owned charging infrastructure overseeing construction, installation, and commissioning of EV charging hardware. This role will support a variety of other exciting CTC charging initiatives including FLEET charging and commercial EV charging strategies. Successful candidates will have a passion for EV adoption and commitment to sustainability initiatives overall.
What you’ll do
Network development – Electric Vehicle (EV) charging stations deployment strategy
Lead the delivery of Canadian Tire Retail’s (CTR’s) EV charging strategy. Direct the design and construction of EV charging facilities across Canada at CTR. Track project milestones and tasks in database; maintain accurate and organized records of required documents. Work collaboratively with internal and external stakeholders to ensure seamless execution of all EV stations minimizing disruption at store level.
Relationship Management - Engages with and develop favorable relationships with charging solutions partners, providers, contractors, utility operators, and EV services companies. Direct interaction with the Dealer network and dealer operations, store planning, Canadian Tire Real Estate (CTREL), IT, Market Strategy, Sustainability etc. The role will work with Federal (National Resources Canada) regarding ongoing reporting obligation for the NRCAN 2 deal as well as evaluate new government funding options.
Operational Support – Develop processes, protocols, and key performance indicators (KPIs) for executing and monitoring partner network charging & installation services, addressing performance shortfalls with partners when necessary. Provide senior leadership with ongoing reporting related to EV charging usage and adoption.
Expense planning and management – Create and manage annual operating budget as well as capital investments including but not limited to equipment upgrades, new non-partner funded sites that are high priority for CTR
EV Customer Experience Management – Use available data and customer surveys and tools to measure customer satisfaction and drive success
People Management – Provide coaching and direction to direct reports, ensure that workflow and objectives are defined, and the team has clearly defined and measurable outcomes. Conduct quarterly and annual reviews ensuring the team is focused on priorities and that you as the manager are helping to remove barriers and secure the appropriate resources to drive success. Provide career coaching and feedback to support the team’s personal goals and aspirations.
Real Estate - Continually work with the CTREL team to identify high potential EV charging locations for EV charging partners
Automotive Merchandise and Service teams - Collaborate with the auto teams to ensure alignment with overall EV strategy and seek opportunities to lever the investment in infrastructure and partner investments to drive related businesses in the same space (ie) FLEET (internal & external), EV charging equipment for sale, EV charging for auto service etc.
Marketing Environmental Social Governance (ESG) teams - Provide regular reporting on role out of EV charging infrastructure, EV stations usage and adoption. Work collaboratively with the marketing team at CTR to drive EV charging investment awareness. Help create a credible marketing position for CTR’s investment in EV.
Dealer & Dealer Operations - Collaborate with Dealer and Dealer operations to ensure exiting and new EV charging stations are a positive addition to the store’s footprint. Ensure all stakeholders desires and requirements are being achieve during after EV chargers are deployed (project management + post project activity).
Government (federal provincial and municipal)- Ensure all CTC’s reporting obligations to National Resources Canada are met in a timely basis and within required structure and format. Continue to foster a close relationship with NRCAN to ensure any and all funding opportunities are reviewed and assessed.
Innovation - This role contributes directly to CTC’s goal of making life in Canada better by filling in a major gap in the adoption of Battery Electric vehicles. CTC’s strategy to deploy a EV charging stations across the country will help alleviate range anxiety with EV drivers (number one concern).
Travel: 2 to 4 days per month for site or vendor visits
What you bring
Bachelor’s degree in business, Sales, Operations
Experience with Utility engagement
Knowledge of CTR’s Dealer network
Knowledge of CTREL’s real-estate process
Proficient with MS-Office, MS-Project, MS-Excel
Familiarity with EV charging ecosystem and industry standards like OCPP (open charge point protocol) and OCPI (open charge point interface), experience integrating IoT or payment and loyalty solutions within this ecosystem.
customer service focus
5+ years of experience, business planning, or similar role
Demonstrated experience in project & construction management, from ideation to delivery
Prior Experience in working across a matrix organization with various stakeholders
Understanding of DCFC(DC Fast Charging) landscape and installation requirements
Supplier and vendor management experience
Self-starter, entrepreneurial mindset, and proven track record of working independently.
#LI-GG1
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of
Canada’s Best Managed Companies
.

column2: Senior Data Analyst - Canadian Tire Corporation
column7:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation’s (CTC) rich heritage of serving Canadians from coast-to-coast dates back to 1922. Our vision is to become the #1 retail brand in Canada and we are focused on innovating and making important investments in our business, especially when it comes to our people. To reach our goal, we need the best talent to help us evolve and drive change across the business – and boldly help shape Canada’s retail industry. As we strive to be at the forefront of a complex and vastly changing retail industry, it is an exciting time to join the Canadian Tire family of companies.
The Senior Data Analyst is responsible for leading & providing support on data collection, transformation, and data synthesis from source systems to the end environments defined by the enterprise. Working in collaboration with the business teams, the analyst will be responsible for translating business rules, establishing efficient data architecture for effective consumption by downstream reporting, applications & other analytical teams. This position requires passion for data and the ability to connect the "data" dots across various data assets.
#LI-FM1
At Canadian Tire we work flexibility embracing ‘Hybrid’ whereby individuals utilize a combination of working at a CTC campus and or virtually in service of outcomes. Determined by managers, decisions around work location will be made based on business and team needs and grounded in a desire to support individual well-being and personal needs. Our goal is to empower teams and individuals to make the right decisions for them, and we expect that to look different for everyone.
What you’ll do
Provide end-to-end support for the enterprise with data collection and disclosure.
Reading, analyzing, and transforming data to specific & agreed on data output formats in a database
Support the varied structured and unstructured data generated / used by the enterprise to create insightful data representation
Provide advice, guidance and make recommendations to teams regarding new data asset collections and disclosures to optimize project outcomes, facilitate initial set-up and provide ongoing operational support.
Develop, improve, and use existing processes to ensure timely delivery of all data collections, distribution, and transfers.
Support operationalization of new processes and recommend process adjustments as needed.
Manage relationship with teams and responds to requests/inquiries from teams.
Create and manage documentation of the processes including periodic reviews.
Coordinate with Manager to execute pertinent data analysis in support of strategic business needs and decision-making process.
Oversee the documentation and training of business users of our various data marts and data sources.
Apply and espouse the principles of good design with respect to databases, programs, and reports to simplify ongoing support and enhance sustainability.
What you bring
Intermediate to expert level understanding of SQL.
Intermediate to expert level knowledge in cloud data environments as well as legacy systems.
Proficient in Excel, PowerPoint and/or Power BI visualization tool
Intermediate to expert level programming experience with SAS, Python and/or R specifically for use in data manipulation.
University degree – Computer Science, or related programming education.
SAS certification considered an asset.
Experience in Retail Industry an asset in any of the following areas: marketing or sales support, operations, and finance
Sound knowledge of data management and design.
Experience with the Data Asset development life cycle.
Passion for data, technology, and implementing technology for process improvement.
Flexibility, energy, and ability to work well with others in a team environment.
Collaborative team players with superior influencing skills, who build relationships easily across various stakeholder groups to move initiatives forward.
Canadian Tire and its family of companies are boldly shaping retail in Canada and we continue to deliver a positive experience for our customers. As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of
Canada’s Best Managed Companies
.

column3: Alcohol and Gaming Commission of Ontario
column7:
The Government of Ontario is committed to Ontario's new online market for internet gaming (iGaming) that is both competitive and protects consumers. iGaming OntarioTM was established in July 2021 as an agency of the Government of Ontario to conduct and manage internet gaming in the province when provided by private gaming operators.

iGaming Ontario (iGO) is seeking for a Senior Procurement Advisor. Reporting to the Program Manager, the Senior Procurement Advisor will provide expert technical procurement advice and lead the development of procurement policies, procedures, systems and standards for the acquisition of goods, non-consulting services and consulting services for iGO in accordance with the principles of the Ontario Public Sector (OPS) Procurement Directive.
What can I expect to do in this role?
Key responsibilities for this role will include:
Engage and advise key stakeholders on procurement policies, procedures, systems, and standards to enable effective and outcomes-focused procurement activities across the organization.
Advise on appropriate procurement governance and performance management mechanisms to monitor, co-ordinate and improve procurement activity and performance.
Prepare the annual procurement planning report for assigned portfolio and lead the discussion with program areas to finalize the plan
Work with the program areas to identify procurement needs and recommend sourcing strategy, taking into consideration procurement value and ensuring compliance with and adherence to OPS Procurement Directives and iGO Purchasing Policies and Procedures
Analyze, assess risks and make decisions to support a fair procurement process
Act as a subject matter expert for iGO as related to all sourcing activities at various stages of the procurement process
Lead and manage the end-to-end process for complex procurement projects.
Provide weekly procurement status update to management across the organization as to the status of all procurement in progress and escalate issues to senior management when required.
Create, manage, and present quarterly procurement pipeline and forecasts to iGO Senior Leadership team.
Manage the vendor performance and risk throughout the procurement and contract lifecycle
Research, develop, implement and review iGO's procurement policy, procedures, systems and standards that meet all legislative and regulatory compliance requirements

How do I qualify?
The ideal candidate will have:
Purchasing Designation, Supply Chain Management designation or post-secondary education (preferably in Supply Chain, Finance, Accounting or Business) and/or 7+ years of relevant work experience.
Expert knowledge of vendor performance and risk management strategies
Expert knowledge and understanding of procurement principles and best practices to manage complex procurements
Expert knowledge and understanding of contract management principles and best practices
Expert Knowledge of the Ontario Government policies, directives and guidelines on procurement (Procurement Directive, Guidelines for IT Goods and Consulting Services, Advertising, Public and Media Relations, Travel Meal & Hospitality Expenses Directive) in order to coordinate an effective and economical procurement and supply program, as well as to coordinate major or multi-year contracts and service level agreements.
A solid background in administering the procurement process for minor to major, complex contracts, as well as consultant assignment projects including contract law, reviewing/editing procurement documents, stakeholders/vendor liaison, detailed analysis of tenders bid for compliance and final document preparation.
Experience in conducting feasibility studies and in preparing business cases to support procurement of goods and services.
Computer applications for word processing, spreadsheet, database, project management and presentation capabilities to create analytical reporting on procurement initiatives.
Strong problem-solving skills are required in order to investigate and solve supply problems, potential liabilities and identify viable options to pursue.

The successful candidate must be eligible to work in Canada and will be subject to a criminal background check.

To apply to this vacancy please submit your application online at our Careers Webpage located at https://www.igamingontario.ca/en by October 25, 2022.
