Job Summary:
Reporting to the Director, Investment Management Reporting, the position will manage a team of Finance professionals responsible for Investment Management Reporting to support Investment Management and Senior Management decision making activities. This will be accomplished by applying a solid understanding of the investments and related strategies for the Fund, enabled by a strong understanding of reporting that is consistent with internal and external industry standards and principles. This will require managing a team of professionals, by setting individuals plans that are consistent with HOOPP’s objectives and providing the day-to-day guidance and support to the team. It is critical that the incumbent can understand and solve complex problems with many dimensions that have an impact across HOOPP.
The incumbent will support the Director, Investment Management Reporting for any ad-hoc reporting requests from senior management and the Board. Also, the individual will be a key contact for Internal Control over Financial Reporting, Operational Controls, Compensation, as well as, Internal/External Audit, external regulators and external vendors providing software as a service.
In support of these primary objectives, the role will lead and direct a growing team of 4 staff, which includes the structuring of the department, training plans, planning objectives along with continuous feedback.
What you will do:
Manage the daily, monthly, quarterly and annual reporting of investment performance, asset mix, stress teting, hedging activity, etc. to Investment Management, Senior Management and the Board.
Provide day-to-day supervision and guidance to the team to ensure that all reporting is accurate, complete and timely.
Manage the production of the final audited monthly consolidated performance reporting package to the CIO.
Lead the evolution of reporting, workflow and automation to continuously improve quality and efficiency.
Work collaboratively with IT and the Business Solutions Group in the development of of solutions to meet reporting needs.
Review and evaluate risk adjusted returns methodologies on a total fund and individual asset class basis.
Ensure that benchmark returns used for the various investment categories are consistent with the Investment Policy and Guidelines; and manage any changes and enhancements to benchmarks to ensure that they are tested, approved, and documented prior to implementation in performance measurement database.
Identify and manage the implementation of performance measurement requirements in new and/or existing systems.
Support the Director, Investment Management Reporting in leading the implementation of Attribution methodologies to enhance performance reporting.
Identify and assess the impact of new investment strategies/products on investment management reporting, including developing and implementing any changes to process and workflow to report them.
Ensure that proper documentation of the various reporting workflow is maintained and that appropriate processes are in place to ensure integrity and to safeguard historical data against loss.
Work with the Director to implement a team structure that best supports Production and Project deliverables simultaneously.
Set priorities and allocate resources to ensure that deliverables are prepared accurately and within agreed upon timeframes.
As a member of Finance Management team, contribute to the division’s business planning process and formulate appropriate action plans to ensure the team delivers on its short-term and long-term objectives.
Foster an environment which supports continuous improvement changes. Initiate, plan and co-ordinate special projects as necessary.
Help create an organizational culture that attracts and retains high quality staff, motivate them to be highly productive and innovative, and provide opportunities for growth and development through continuous assessment, coaching, and mentoring team members.
In partnership with other professionals in Investment Finance, evaluate existing operational processes against the changing organizational needs and best practices within the industry, in order to identify opportunities for improvement and coordinate the implementation of changes.
What you bring:
Minimum 10 years of relevant progressive experience in the investment/pension industry
Comprehensive understanding of front, middle and back office processes and technical applications.
Minimum 5 years of experience leading in a team-based organization or multi-functional team.
University or post-graduate degree in the following fields: finance, commerce, economics, business administration, mathematics.
A professional designation or working towards a professional designation (i.e., CPA, CFA, FRM) would be an asset.
Practical experience with portfolio structures and multi-asset portfolios and an in depth knowledge of the financial securities and derivatives traded.
Strong understanding and practical experience with compliance, performance measurement and performance attribution methodologies.
Ability to document and provide analysis of performance for Senior Executives.
Excellent research, technical, analytical and verbal/written communication skills.

The Production Manager role at DNEG is a rare opportunity in managing the largest VFX feature films, where we have two or more sequence Line Producers. The role will see you working closely with the Producer and Supervisors to master an effective plan for the show, finding solutions to creative and technical challenges, and planning accordingly.

You will be managing the Line Producers, helping them define clear milestones for the delivery of assets, shots, temps and finals, and working with them to produce detailed shot schedules tracking weekly progress. Excellent communication skills are needed as you will be working closely with the Company Scheduler and Heads of Departments to manage crew needs, and creating an effective approach for the visual effects work.

Must have
Minimum 5 years VFX Feature Film industry experience
Proven track record of delivering sequences at Line Producer or equivalent level
Excellent knowledge of VFX in order to make critical calls on crew allocations and resourcing, especially as the show nears delivery
Proven project management experience
Knowledge of Excel and MS Project (or similar)
Experience in database work
Experience in managing artists and clients
Nice to have
Knowledge of Filemaker
About you
Passionate about film
Clear in planning with artists, supervisors, and clients
Organized and methodical in your approach to the work
Calm under pressure and capable of delivering to short deadlines
A strong, clear communicator, leading teams with enthusiasm
A positive, can-do attitude

column2: Sales and Account Manager (Spirits and Wine Industry)
column7:
SALES & ACCOUNT ACTIVATIONS MANAGER
Sovereign Wine & Spirits is a Canadian liquor agency that is committed to sourcing and curating a portfolio that services the growing population of astute drinkers and the establishments that serve them in the Canadian market. We are driven to find exemplary brands that are cocktail- focused, have ethical ideologies, strong brand positioning for back bars, that can be tools for bartenders and can help seamlessly compliment retail programs.
Aside from representing and shepherding independent brands, we are also passionate about fostering the growth of the hospitality and drinks industry via educational initiatives and community building. Our company is expanding and we are looking for driven team members.
JOB ROLE: F/T, P/T Sales & Account Activations Manager, Ontario
Reporting to the General Manager the Sales & Account Activations Manager is a very dynamic and important role within the company, with a focus on driving sales depletion within the parameters set alongside company expectations.
Candidate will also be responsible for brand activations and community events for both licensees, liquor stores, specialty stores and the general public.
The Sales & Account Activations Manager role requires the candidate to be self-initialized, highly organized, team-oriented, creative, and a good communicator.
Candidate needs to coordinate and liaise with licensees as well as Sovereign’s management team to develop and maintain partner relationships while increasing our brands market share and awareness through education, launches, marketing, and both consumer & staff tastings
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
General Responsibilities
Promotes and increases sales within the retail channels through the aggressive execution of national and regional sales and marketing strategies.
In collaboration with the head office, develop and cascade sales objectives against the business fundamentals of distribution, pricing, shelf, promotion and display/visibility to the field sales team.
Ensure all national and regional sales objectives are consistently communicated to the
General Manager and Head Office on a weekly basis including our warehouse inventory checks.
Responsible for managing regional Retail A&P budgets and ensuring that fiscally responsible spends and appropriate ROI maximization are achieved.
Promotes and increases within the on-premise and off-premise channels through the aggressive execution of national and regional sales and marketing strategies
Creates & monitors implementation and execution of all applicable brand activations and sales programming in assigned territory; helps identify potential barriers
Communicates new items, opportunities, programs, promotions, store/licensee level price chances to management
Leverages new sales opportunities and maintains existing sales avenues through created programming.
Participates in general goal setting and company forecasting activities
Assists in investigation of customer issues, concerns or complaints
Prepares and/or sources relevant material for meetings with customers and suppliers to address performance objectives, effectiveness of pricing strategies, and success of new item launches;
Tracks and analyzes depletion data and its relationship to brand performance
Assists in managing and coordinating brand budgets
Is a key supplemental sales marketing contact alongside management for large/chain accounts
Assists in maintaining company database of suppliers, vendors, product specs, freight forwarders and other related items
Assists in developing new on-premise and off-premise accounts within assigned territory
Assists in delegating tasks to management, teammates, vendors and suppliers as needed
Participates in in-market consumer tasting events, shows, staff trainings, and general ambassadorial duties
Performs other job related duties as assigned
Help create and facilitate the company’s trademark “Spirited Sessions”
Help create and digitally distribute Sovereign Newsletter, “Behind the Bar” o Cocktail of the month o Featured Post
Help to create and facilitate “Bartender Pop Ups”
Charity and Community engagement based on Sovereign’s high CSR
KEY COMPETENCIES
Setting Sales Unit Strategy o Establishing a plan to achieve the Retail channel sales objectives, taking into consideration overall business and sales goals, market opportunities, past sales results, and available resources; reviewing progress and adjusting the plan as needed.
Making Sales Operations Decisions o Making day to day decisions required to manage the sales function, including deploying resources, allocating costs, and directing sales activities. o Securing and comparing information from multiple sources to identify key issues. o Committing to an action after weighing alternative solutions against important decision criteria.
Liaising with the LCBO o Curating relationships with the individual spirit category managers o Organizing and following up on sample drop offs and listing applications
Driving for Results/Raising the Bar o Setting high goals for personal and group accomplishment; using measurement methods to monitor progress toward goals; tenaciously working to meet or exceed goals while deriving satisfaction from that achievement and continuous improvement. o Minimum of 20 physical check ins per week
Guiding Sales Opportunities/Business Acumen o Developing strategic sales solutions and courses of action for customers that appropriately consider available facts, constraints, competitive circumstances, strategic priorities, and probable consequences. o Clearly connecting solutions to business needs. o Assists in analyzing sales and other relevant company metrics; creates customized presentation materials when needed; prepares forecasting material based on historical sales data and profitability
Broadening Business Value o Exploring customers’ underlying issues that suggest broader solutions o Maximizing the productiveness of sales interactions by building on customer cues to gain commitment to products, services, and solutions o Articulating and promoting a path forward.
Sales Negotiation o Effectively exploring alternatives and positions to reach mutually beneficial sales agreements that gain customers’ acceptance and commitment.
JOB REQUIREMENTS
Communication – clearly and succinctly conveying information and ideas to individuals and groups in a variety of situations, communicating in a focused and compelling way that drives others’ thoughts and actions.
Building Trusting Relationships – using appropriate interpersonal styles to establish effective relationships with customers and internal partners; interacting with others in a way that promotes openness and trust and gives them confidence in one’s intentions.
Creating a Service Reputation – Crafting and implementing service practices that meet customers’ and own organization’s needs; using appropriate interpersonal styles and techniques to resolve difficult customer situations and regain customer confidence.
Formal Presentation – Presenting ideas effectively to individuals or groups when given time to prepare; delivering presentations suited to the characteristics and needs of the audience.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
University degree
Minimum of 3-5 years of sales experience, supervisory or team lead experience in a related or complementary field.
Proven ability to deal successfully with multiple channels of distribution with success.
Strong time management and organization skills with attention to detail and accuracy
Self-Initiated
Proactive problem solver
Experience in digital marketing and community management preferred
Experienced in outside sales
Flexible schedule and can work from anywhere
Has proven contacts in the market
Industry knowledge pertaining to liquor industry
Travel required - Must have a valid driver’s license
Proficient in MS Office; experience with Excel and PowerPoint
Any other spirit, wine or beer training preferred (WSET, CSS).
Job Types: Part-time, Freelance
Part-time hours: 10-20 per week
Salary: $32,000.00-$70,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Flextime
Work from home
Supplemental pay types:
Commission pay
Ability to commute/relocate:
Toronto, ON: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)

At CEP, we have engineers, scientists, professionals, forensic experts… but above all, we have determination! We believe that the best way to develop your potential while having fun is to not take yourself too seriously. In our team, discipline and sense of humour work hand in hand to create a warm and friendly work environment.
The exceptional skill of each of our employees is what makes us strong. We rely on our multidisciplinary team to promote communication, efficiency and the best of partnerships.
We are excited to invite CRM Analysts to be part of our awesome team in Ontario or Alberta. Read on to find what does the position sound like...
About the Role!
Working closely with the leadership team, the CRM Analyst provides analytical support for data-driven business planning and decision-making by the stakeholders.
Reporting to the Strategy manager the CRM Analyst plays a key role as a catalyst in the evolution of the CRM and ultimately maximizing value and utilization from CEP’s data resources. Working with qualitative, quantitative, large, complex, and unstructured data and distilling it to meaningful insights that inspire powerful actions for business growth, this role accelerates and improves CEP’s ability to make decisions by ensuring access to timely and accurate information.
What will you be doing!
Conduct in-depth exploratory analysis and interpretation of clients database as well as acquired market intelligence data and turn the information into knowledge to help devise and steer business strategy, goals, long and short terms campaigns and client relationship management initiatives.
Cleanse, validate, update, and consistently maintain, and ensure currency and integrity of CEP's database of contacts for business development, response to marketing campaigns, channel preferences, service history, inquiries, complaints, trends, patterns, etc.
Maintain & manage key controls showing ownership, frequency, and SLA’s across the administrative group to ensure quality of firsthand data inputs.
Analyze campaign results. Develop and present knowledge-board of results vs KPIs backed by data-driven reports, infographics showing trends & patterns, and include proactive identification and reporting of emerging issues.
Track, report and improve upon actual performance metrics of individual campaigns and strategic KPIs for retention, engagement, and customer lifetime value.
Build and execute User Retention campaigns that guide clients to relevant products and services offered by CEP.
Engage with partner organizations, customers, and coordinate market research activities as and when needed.
Provide ongoing training and coaching on best practices to all users of the company (marketing, business development, experts, support staff);
Comply with the requirements of the Company’s Quality Management System (QMS) that complies with the ISO 9001:2015 Standards. Participate in internal and external audits as and when required.
What do you bring!
Education, Experience and Skills
Undergraduate degree in Business Administration
3+ years of experience business analysis working with Salesforce Lightning
Are You…?
Strong understanding of how a CRM application can be utilized in an organization
Superior verbal & written communication skills *
Strong analytical, organizing, and presentation skills
Detail oriented with and high concern for accuracy and integrity of data
Ability to envision the “big picture” while managing the details and focusing on multiple objectives or assignments
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely both in a verbal and written manner
Job Type: Full-time

Requisition ID: 156570

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Purpose

The Operations Representative will provide day-day processing coverage of a variety of high volume brokerage operational financial and non-financial transactions as well as ensuring integrity of client information and balances. Operational knowledge required in this role may include but is not limited to Client Onboarding, Account Management, Regulatory Documentation, Brokerage Transfers, Cash Management & Registered Products

The successful candidate will demonstrate thorough knowledge of compliant operational processes and procedures, in order to provide accurate information and solutions when responding to internal and external customer inquiries and issues. They will possess proficient telephone, email and written communications skills when corresponding with clients, iTRADE colleagues or internal/ external partners.

Accountabilities

1. To ensure the efficient and effective handling of operational / administrative financial and non-financial transactions on behalf of iTRADE brokerage clients:

Ensure transaction requests are completed compliantly according to business policy with a high degree of competence within defined service levels
Ensure customer and corporate records are accurately maintained and reconciled in order to minimize firm exposure or risk
Ensure that client or firm risk is mitigated but reporting anomalies to the Team Manager or Manager.
Exercise discretion and sound judgment when correcting errors
Monitor client accounts to ensure that appropriate documentation changes have been made, and correction requests have been completed
Process various customer and internal requests, transfers and / or conversions (which will vary in dollar amount and difficulty)

2. To ensure a superior level of customer experience and client experience:

Respond to inbound inquiries from the Call Centers in an informed, efficient manner, within established SLAs
Efficiently resolve complaints and errors, using proper judgement to refer complex issues or escalations to your Team Manager or Manager.
Liaise with various support partners such as Compliance or Wealth Operations when needed, to ensure client issues are resolved in a timely manner
Perform financial corrections and adjustments in client accounts within authorized limits and/or defined approval criteria

3. To actively collaborate with internal staff and support departments to ensure that business needs are met:

Actively participate in a team learning through active cross-training, developmental and team performance activities including team meetings and coaching sessions
Obtain and forward necessary documentation to customers and / or other departments to ensure transactions are completed efficiently and accurately
Pro-actively investigate and follow up on inquiries or escalations and refer to Team Manager or Manager as necessary
Collaborate with iTRADE Call Centers or other partners across the Bank to ensure client request are responded to effectively and efficiently.
Provide reports and statistical information to management and / or other departments as required

4. To minimize potential risk and harm for the business:

Develop familiarity in areas including money laundering, anti-terrorist financing, privacy laws, compliance, legal requirements, Know Your Customer, etc
Act quickly to alleviate errors such that firm exposure / risk is reduced
Adhere to the Guidelines for Business Conduct and Privacy Code, demonstrating a full understanding of the legal implications of dealing with customer requests while all times maintaining the confidentiality of customer information
Adhere to the policies and practices that regulate the firm / industry by escalating complaints and / or potential risk exposure to management; take appropriate measures to reduce and prevent reoccurrence of error / problem situations

Education/Work Experience/ Other Information

Post-secondary education
1-2 years industry experience
Canadian Securities Course (CSC) and Conduct and Practice handbook (CPH) an asset
Prior knowledge of the securities / brokerage operations including areas such as Client Onboarding, Brokerage Transfers, Cash Management and Regulatory Documentation
Prior knowledge of financial industry policies and regulations including AML, Privacy, KYC and CASL
Strong organization, problem solving, customer service and communications skills
Strong time management skills to ensure Service Levels are always maintained
Ability to work with computer based platforms and applications
Knowledge of AS400, Broadridge, SCORE, WebPost, OAM/ICON or STAR an asset
Ability to work in a fast paced environment where volumes are directed by market activity, customer demands and seasonal peaks
Ability to work with others under a self managed team structure showing concern and understanding for the needs of customers and staff
Ability to set and achieve goals, with guidance and coaching from management
Ability to exercise discretion with sensitive information
Demonstrated PC user skills including word processing, MS Office, spreadsheets and database management
Ability and desire to learn new tasks willingly

Dimensions

The incumbent will work independently within the boundaries of existing business policies and guidelines. He / she is expected to demonstrate a high level of competency by processing high volumes of financial or non-financial transactions, responding to internal and client inquires and working on adhoc projects as required.
The incumbent will escalate complex issues / situations to their Team Manager or Manager as necessary. The incumbent does not have the authority to override policy without Manager approval.
The incumbent must demonstrate strong communication skills so that he / she can effectively provide detailed information to various departments.
The incumbent must exercise judgment in the prioritization of his / her workload. The incumbent must adhere to processing deadlines (within established SLA), such that customer satisfaction / processing efficiency levels are met, and maintained.

Working Conditions

Open office environment with constant background noise
High call volumes, with customers becoming very agitated as on-hold times rise
Concentrated use of sight and hearing when reviewing documentation / reports / preparing various financial documents
Flexibility of hours is a typical requirement for this position. (Beyond the traditional 9-5 workday, sometimes including evening / weekend work depending on business volume).

Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Build a meaningful career
At LifeWorks, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 7,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.
Summary:

The Business Analyst is responsible for providing business analysis expertise, and for delivering detailed requirements and specifications related to LifeWorks' proprietary applications for our Health and Productivity Solutions line of business.
In a typical day, you’ll meet with business stakeholders, developers and system architects to gather the information you need to create wireframes, process models and detailed functional specifications.
You’ll investigate and research both new business issues and requests for changes to our systems depending on the nature of the request.
Throughout the software lifecycle, you will support developers, IT QA specialists and business UAT resources to clarify requirements; occasionally, you’ll do the testing, too.
As a change is rolled out, you’ll help your business stakeholders understand how it works and how to use it. At times may be required to work overtime, weekends and evenings to accelerate requirement timelines and support testing during system deployments.
Our ideal candidate, is a patient listener. You understand very technical subjects, but can easily explain them in non-technical language. You’re not necessarily a developer, but you understand application development concepts and can easily engage in a technical discussion. You’re a problem-solver and capable of proposing options to support business decision making. You also have an interest to understand the industry and business processes of the department. You focus on understanding what the user really needs and design solutions that add value, are feasible and can be implemented within budget.
Responsibilities:
Works with internal business users and assigned project resources collecting and analyzing business requirements for project implementations, ongoing maintenance and system enhancements.
Produces detailed requirements and specifications, wireframes and models used by business users and development team.
Produces testing documents and test cases, and performs testing as required.
Supports systems development teams and business areas as required.
Continuously devises ways to improve team operations.
Builds knowledge of industry topics and trends through internal training, external training and self-study, as appropriate.
Performs other tasks and special projects, as required.
Qualifications:
7+ years of experience as a business analyst preferably in a technically-oriented environment and worked on technical assignments and/or projects
Experience in absence or disability management, group insurance, HR/payroll systems is an asset.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience in project management is an asset.
Solid understanding of The Software Development Life Cycle.
Demonstrated knowledge or experience with various analysis and techniques to write detailed specifications and requirements for software development.
Experience with and uses various visual modelling techniques that is appropriate for the type and scope of the assignment.
Understanding concepts in data modelling and relational database design.
Lead and collaborate with business Subject Matter Experts (SME), business resources, Project Managers, other Business Analysts, and developers to ensure that solutions are thoroughly though through and issues and risks are identified and resolved.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Excellent time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments.
Ability to work independently, takes initiative, and exercise good judgement.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving and creative-thinking skills.
Exceptional customer focus and strong professional acumen.
Demonstrated knowledge of software development concepts (focus on internet applications and mobile applications).
Basic understanding of negotiation, conflict management and risk management skills.
Reliable, consistent, flexible and adaptable.
Experienced in estimating complexity, time and effort, planning and worked closely with Project Managers to successfully meet requirements and timelines.

Fulfilling work that matters
LifeWorks is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve. We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.
At LifeWorks, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. What does Grand & Toy offer?
An opportunity to be part of a team that is going places, delivering new and exciting technology.
A culture that is actively committed to innovation and challenging the status quo.
A competitive salary and benefits package based on education and experience.
Health benefits coverage, employer matched retirement savings plans, employee discount programs.
Comprehensive training for all new associates.
To be part of a company that gives back to our local communities.

Who is Grand & Toy?
Grand & Toy partners with customers to change the way Canadian businesses work and help them compete. And what we do for others, we do for ourselves. We’re a passionate team of diverse individuals who are focused on coming together to bring positive transformation to our customers and vendor partners by setting new standards for ourselves and our teams. We embrace transformation and innovate for customers and partners, and our employees as well. At Grand & Toy, you can be part of the change by learning and growing along with the business.

What will I do?
The Business Development Manager (BDM) is a sole contributor, field sales role, responsible for prospecting by phone, email and in-person meetings with prospective mid-market B2B customers. You will be the primary contact for customer decision-makers and responsible for the full sales process. This is a 100% hunter role. Following the award of a sales contract, you will work closely with the Account Manager and Sales Management as well as other company resources to successfully transition account implementation and management responsibilities to them.

This is an excellent opportunity if you are confident approaching and engaging with potential business customers, from manager to C level. You have a solution sales approach and excel in research, lead generation and delivering convincing sales presentations to close new business customers. You are competitive, organized, focused and enjoy the challenge of creating win/win solutions.

What qualifications do I need?
Post-secondary degree or diploma in a business or marketing related discipline
Minimum of 3-5 years validated sales success in an outside (field) B2B sales role with a deep understanding of consultative selling and sales planning
Strong knowledge of prospecting/ telesales and sales process.
Experience with, or ability to learn, and utilize, a complex pricing, order and sales tracking database tool
Confident speaking and delivering compelling sales presentations to all levels of customer, from entry level to senior executive
Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills with the ability to build rapport with potential customers
Strong negotiation skills and closing ability
Ability to function independently with little or no supervision as well as function in a team environment
Able to handle multiple priorities through effective organization and time management skills
Local market knowledge with established business connections as well as proven networking skills to help you to succeed
Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, video presentations and CRM tools is required
Bilingualism in English and French is an asset

We celebrate employment equity and diversity. We are committed to providing accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

A little about us
What we do at Shaw matters - in a world where being connected has never been more critical, we bring the best wireline and wireless technology and solutions together to create exceptional customer experiences. Every day we help millions of Canadians live their best-connected lives through the strength, capacity and combined power of our Fast LTE and Fibre+ networks.At Shaw we say we’re brighter together, and we believe it’s the diverse mix of brilliant people here that really makes us shine. When you join our team, you’ll see we are so much more than just a company. Shaw connects you with limitless opportunity, an incredible culture, career development and a great benefits package. We are a friendly, collaborative group, and we have a lot of fun finding new ways to delight our customers.Come dream bigger and brighter with Shaw.
The role
As a Marketing Manager, Customer Base Management you will be responsible for the following:
Analysis and insight (65%)
Create customer insight by independently analyzing data from using Tableau dashboards, or by directly pulling data from database with SQL
Build hypothesis by analyzing base movements and partner with the respective teams to validate it with deep dive analysis.
Analyzes campaign and program outputs and recommend changes to improve performance of campaigns/programs
Program / Campaign Management (35%)
Build proactive campaigns and programs to mitigate churn and increase revenue
Oversee the program execution end to end from idea generation to post analysis
Brief communication team to create campaign communication materials
A typical day
In a typical day you will be
Pulling data from databases using SQL and analyzing base movements to create actionable customer insight.
Monitoring program performance by pulling data from database using SQL and / or reporting tools like PowerBI, Tableau
Working with respective teams on program performance and make necessary tweaks in offers/processes/strategy to achieve retention and revenue targets,
Developing programs and briefing data analytics and communication teams to make sure right customers get the right message to achieve your strategic goal.
Your skills/experience
3+ years of Marketing experience preferably in loyalty, churn, retention, or CRM (Telecommunication industry experience is an asset)
Analytical in nature who can turn data into customer insight.
Excellent interpersonal skills with ability to interact with all levels of organization
Self starter who feels comfortable under ambiguity
Ability to run multiple projects at the same time
Computer Skills: SQL, Excel, Word, Power Point are must. Tableau and Power BI knowledge is preferable.
Other details
This position requires the successful completion of a criminal and credit background check
This role is location-specific Toronto HQ
At Shaw, we believe diversity and inclusion are integral to the continued growth and success of our entire company. We believe diversity and inclusion enhances our Company’s culture and creates a sense of belonging where people feel comfortable bringing their true selves to work. This in turn promotes innovation through harnessing the variety of experiences, thoughts, and perspectives our employees have to offer. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals, regardless of race, gender, age, or any other identifying characteristic.

The use and disclosure of the collected information is for the sole purpose of job search and placement activities for Shaw Communications. The information is subject to Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act. The information will be retained and when disposed of, it is done so in a secure manner. Your profile will become inactive and moved to the archive if you do not access your profile for a period of 1 year.

Investment Analyst / Senior Investment Analyst
Why you’ll love this role
The Investment Analyst provides assistance to the Portfolio Management team in managing an investment portfolio to maximize its return within the Investment policy framework and according to the client's objectives.
What you’ll be working on
Collect and analyze industry, company and economic information from a variety of sources including websites, institutional research, corporate reports and industry publication
Review Annual Reports, Quarterlies and Proxy Statements
Conduct regular meetings with management teams of companies both in our portfolio and investment universe
Attend industry and company events to gather information such as investors day, company tours and industry conference
Analyze financial information relating to companies via annual reports, quarterly reports and investor presentations
Write research reports and present to management to assist in key portfolio decision making
Construct stock screens using software such as Bloomberg to filter database of companies to identify potential investment ideas
Organize all available information and data effectively in order to build and maintain spreadsheet models for both valuation and monitoring purposes
Determine both buy and sell targets for companies based on a combination of all the qualitative and quantitative information collected
Present investment ideas to the broader Investment Team
Keep abreast of portfolio strategy, developments in the Canadian and Global economic and political environment and fluctuations in the capital markets
Maintain statistics on the portfolio regarding exposures, company information and valuation parameters
Communicate portfolio positioning ideas to the portfolio managers
Perform other special projects related to investment or theme ideas for the Portfolio managers as required
Market individual fund management capabilities including making presentations to existing and potential clients

What you’ll need to have
1+ years experience in investment research or related positions
Completion of a university degree with courses in finance, investments, economics, mathematics, statistics, ethics
CFA or working toward designation
Well-developed mathematical skills
Strong research, financial modeling, risk management and a thorough understanding of various investment valuation concepts
Clear written and verbal communication skills
Ability to plan tactically or plan strategically
Attention to detail/accuracy
Ability to think logically, analyze and/or solve problems

We acknowledge and reward talent, and support our employees in achieving and exceeding individual and organizational goals. At Cardata, our goal is to simplify the administrative and financial burdens experienced by companies with employees on the road. We partner with our customers to find the easiest and most cost-effective solution, using best-in-class technology, to reimburse their employees for using their personal vehicles for work.
We're moving into the next chapter of our company's growth and are looking for an avid problem solver to join our team as a Sales & Marketing Operations Specialist!
Who you are:
You provide administrative support to the sales, business development and marketing teams, enabling them to drive revenue through the pipeline. Reporting directly to the Demand Generation Manager, you will become the CRM expert and the go-to person for reporting, troubleshooting and database management. You will be at the center of our growth team influencing how we use our CRM and leveraging our technology stack. You will also be dedicated to developing a state of the art marketing operations program to ensure we have the right strategy, framework and processes in place. Additionally, you will work cross-functionally to conduct competitive analyses and develop sales enablement materials and training.
What you'll be doing:
- Own the administration and expertise of our CRM, including data management, reporting and troubleshooting
- Establish a scalable marketing and sales operations process to ensure best practices in CRM management and automation
- Coordinate the reporting and tracking of our sales and marketing performance metrics, recommend and execute A/B testing and other tactics to improve pipeline
- Act as the main point of contact for all questions related to Cardata’s sales and marketing technology stack
- Build the framework and foundations necessary to deliver personalized marketing campaigns
- Provide and build out recommendations to automated email strategies and sales outreach
- Analyze campaign tracking, lead scoring, lead management, and attribution to advocate for areas of opportunity
- Train, support and onboard users to HubSpot and our various technology stacks
- Other projects as assigned
What you'll bring to this role:
- 2+ years experience with HubSpot CRM (or similar) and marketing automation platforms
- Proven experience in setting up and optimizing marketing automation software and CRM database management
- Strong understanding of relevant technology solutions. Experience with ZoomInfo, Clearbit, Aircall, ABM platforms is a plus
- Ability to create dynamic dashboards and reporting
- Excellent communication and problem-solving skills
- Avid problem solver and the ability to work under pressure
- Self-starter with the ability to take direction and deliver results
- Interest in business with the desire to learn and help Cardata grow
Nice-to-Haves
- Bachelor's degree in Business, Marketing, or another related field
- HubSpot Sales Software certification is a bonus
- Pipeline Due Diligence in a sale focused environment
Why You’ll Love Working at Cardata
Cardata provides you with a flexible, autonomous environment that encourages employees to experiment, innovate and learn. As part of our team, you will be surrounded by supportive leaders and caring colleagues who are dedicated to taking on new challenges, focusing on the customer, and working as a team to achieve success. Additionally, you will be provided with:
- Flexible working hours
- 100% employer paid benefits

column3: Pario Engineering and Environmental Sciences LP
column7:
Company:
Pario Engineering and Environmental Sciences LP
National Director, Business Development - Full-time (Ontario, Alberta, or British Columbia)
Reporting to the Vice President, National Business Development, the incumbent is a member of the national sales team and is responsible for the implementation of engineering & environmental sales initiatives to support growth and new profitable products and segments aligned with the Vice President, Business Development. The incumbent will be responsible for assisting, creating and implementing sales procedures to successfully execute our extraordinary growth strategy. The successful incumbent will also have input on the direction and creation of strategic marketing, product and branding initiatives.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for delivering marketing materials to clients & prospective clients associated with the business to ensure it aligns with the national sales strategy & accurately represents our products (supported by the Vice President, National Business Development)
Support of the Corporate Linked In site and responsible for sharing regular content to portray corporate brand in alignment with SCM marketing team
Responsible for upkeep & tracking of new business prospects and sales funnels
Provide assistance to the Vice President of Business Development with proposals, RFP’s, presentations, templates etc.…
Required to attend industry events & help co-ordinate industry events for the National Sales team
Administrative responsibilities surrounding client database, sales territory planning and account services instructions for all clients
Responsible to attend client facing meetings with the Vice President of National Business Development, independently and with Business Development Managers.
Account management and market share development with existing customers
Accountability for deadlines, irregular work hours, but being available during core business hours nationally (EST, PST time zones)
Professionally representing our organization at industry events, internal functions etc… Always being an ambassador of the Pario brand
Ability to travel nationally when required
Education, Experience, and Knowledge Required:
University Degree, College Degree, CRM or CIP, or relevant industry experience
A strong background in the field of engineering, risk management, insurance, claims, marketing and/or sales is a must for this role.
Basic understanding of the Property and Casualty insurance market and technical wordings; P&C national market intelligence; Strong Business Acumen; Claims, Adjusting, Legal, Risk Management expertise an asset; Microsoft office product expertise and familiarity with leading claims practices & systems / CRM designation considered an asset
Skills Required:
Sales & Marketing background; Underwriting; Engineering; Accountability; Coaching; Strong Communication Skills; Strategic; Customer Focused Thinking; Risk Management Expertise; Teamwork; Positive; Integrity; Honesty
SCM Insurance Services and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process.

Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP is one of Canada’s leading business law firms. Advising many of Canada’s corporate leaders, as well as U.S. and international parties with extensive interest in Canada, our more than 1,000 firm members are based in offices in Toronto, Montréal, Ottawa, Vancouver, Calgary and New York.
Osler prides itself on attracting and maintaining some of the brightest talent in the legal arena. Our lawyers, students, management and staff have created a unique firm culture which nurtures mentoring and the exchange of ideas. Osler is a dynamic and exciting place to begin a career or carve out a new path.
Reporting to the Manager, Billing Accounts, the Billing Specialist is responsible for assisting in all phases of client billing and collection, including bill preparation, submission, follow-up and communication with clients and Partners and subsequent payment and outstanding bill collection. This is a detail oriented position with an emphasis on tenacity, time management, technical tasks and interpersonal skills.
Major Responsibilities
Prioritize and execute tasks required to improve realizations by ensuring work-in-process inventory is billed regularly and in formats expected by our clients
Co-ordinate the execution of tasks with practice group Legal Assistants, Partners and others in the broader Billing and Collection department
Manage client relationships on behalf of the firm and/or individual Partners to expedite the payment of invoices by:
Reviewing engagement letters, outside counsel billing guidelines, and billing arrangements related details where appropriate to ensure billing compliance with client requirements
Managing client inquiries through to resolution
Maintain detailed records of client communications in the system
Assist Partners with the preparation of documents to close client transactions through the firm’s trust accounts
Process pre-bills received via Pre-Bill Viewer and handle monthly billings for Partners
Draft and finalize client invoices for distribution to clients
Oversee and coordinate month end billing and collections. Deal with escalation of billing & collection disputes and act as first point of contact before escalation
Follow up with Manager, Billing Accounts, Partners and clients as appropriate regarding overdue accounts and WIP using various reports and systems
Initiate contact with client regarding outstanding receivables. Handle client inquiries and resolve discrepancies and maintain accurate records of all communications in the system
Resolve any unresolved or partial payments received from clients
Maintain good relations with internal and external clients
Position Requirements
Education and Experience
The position requires a university degree in a business discipline, including some accounting and finance courses with a minimum of 3 years of billing or accounts receivable experience. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be acceptable.
Knowledge and Skills
To be successful in this position, the successful candidate must be solution-oriented and able to work under pressure
Professional mannerisms for effectively communicating with legal professionals and clients
High proficiency in computer software programs such as, spreadsheet programs and database systems
Maturity to interact with senior members of the Firm, in order to earn their trust and confidence
Experience with Aderant software would be an asset
Excellent communication skills (both oral and written), focused listening, interpersonal and negotiation skills
Attention to detail, organization and time management skills along with the ability to balance daily work
Positive attitude, patience, resilience and a sense of humour
A compliance and procedural mindset is required
For the safety of firm members and visitors, Osler is committed to complying with the recommendations of public health authorities, including with respect to adopting mandatory vaccination policies. Employment at Osler is therefore conditional on complying with any vaccination policies that Osler may adopt from time to time in response to the recommendations of public health authorities
Accessibility and Accommodation
We thank all applicants for their interest in Osler; however, only chosen applicants will be contacted. Osler is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive work environment, and we welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and people with diverse backgrounds, identities, and cultures. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates in all phases of the selection process.
Background and Reference Checks
Please note that any offer of employment will be conditional upon background and reference checks, including a criminal record check, credit check, and employment and educational verifications.
If you have the required background with the ability to provide exceptional customer service and wish to work in one of Canada's leading law firms, please reply in confidence with a cover letter and résumé by the closing date.

Who we are:
Financeit is a point-of-sale financing provider serving some of the largest home improvement and retail organizations in Canada.
Our platform helps businesses of any size close more sales by offering customers affordable monthly payment options for their next big home improvement, vehicle or retail purchase. Financeit is small enough that you can make an impact within the company and large enough to make an impact in the market.
As focused as we are on creating unique, category-defining products, we are also building a distinct and inclusive culture. We’re a diverse and dynamic team seeking the best and brightest talent to help us achieve our company goals, and to continue to build on our award winning culture.
About the role:
This B2B role involves managing existing enterprise level relationships and working directly with executives and key stakeholders to promote consumer financing programs to dealer networks across Canada. To be successful in this role, you will need to be a highly motivated individual with a passion for making mutually beneficial partnerships grow. You will develop and enforce plans that will help meet the needs of your partners, consult on best practices as a trusted advisor, and execute with cross functional teams. You are a strategic analytical thinker with strong problem-solving skills, focused on customer service above all else. You have a strong business acumen and are comfortable multi-tasking in a fast-paced, while holding yourself accountable for results.

What you’ll do:
Develop and lead the corporate partnership strategy to build brand awareness and growth. Through the identification of high impact, strategic opportunities, you build the roadmap for corporate partnership and drive execution
Developing and executing business development strategies with the goal of expanding the partner base (with a focus on high potential partners
Build a strong sales pipeline through outbound prospecting and networking
Deliver effective, custom sales presentations and product demonstrations to prospects
Actively identifying and developing new business development opportunities.
Growing the firm’s database of prospects and transitioning them to the firm’s investment services and products.
Develop, maintain, and manage strong long-term relationships with existing large accounts
Works autonomously as the lead resource for strategic accounts, while developing partner marketing calendar, program proposals, and on-going projects
Manage on-boarding, training, and launch plans, working with marketing and merchant sales organization to activate newly won accounts
Leverage data-based tools to provide business KPIs and on-going reporting to strategic partners
Manage quarterly business reviews with leadership and support teams
Deliver consistently against assigned volume goals, while prioritizing and delivering an excellent business experience to Financeit’s key partners
Secure and renew partnership contracts, while negotiating preferential terms to meet business targets
Recommend best practices to improve planned consumer financing programs with a deep understanding of target market and dynamics
Use expert product knowledge and sales consultation to increase partner engagement
Work quickly to address and resolve partner issues while coordinating with internal and external resources
Requirements
What you’ll need to succeed:
BA degree or equivalent practical experience
5 years of experience with business development, and hands-on face to face direct sales
Demonstrated expertise in managing successful business-to-business sales and service relationships
Experience in consumer lending, SaaS or financial services is preferred
You know your way around a CRM, ideally Salesforce
Strong interpersonal and organizational skills
Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines under pressure
Benefits
Winner of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Culture in 2018 and 2021, we offer more than just the basics. Take advantage of:
An award-winning culture with a collaborative & inclusive team
Competitive pay and performance based bonus
Committed to flexible work arrangements, offering fully remote and hybrid workplace options, as well as a hybrid working allowance
Weekly virtual yoga classes, meditation & workout sessions
Virtual events such as Lunch & Learns, company parties, fun team activities and charity initiatives
Career learning and development programs
Next Steps:
If what you just read excites you, we’d like to hear from you! Please submit your application and we’ll contact you if you become selected for a phone interview.
Financeit is an equal opportunity employer. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Build a meaningful career
At LifeWorks, we offer more than career opportunities, we provide career opportunities to make meaningful contributions to people’s lives. The extraordinary expertise of a more than 7,000-strong workforce is harnessed to support the employees and families of the organizations we serve. Our innovative programs have a lasting impact on the health, financial security and productivity of 24,000 workplaces.
LifeWorks can provide clarity among plan options and take the strain out of communications between members, administrators and fund managers. Our Ariel administration system is a robust recordkeeping platform that supports membership database updates, and provides electronic data interfaces, calculations and transactions.

Our Bilingual Senior Pension Analyst works in a team and is responsible for administering pension plans for assigned clients and providing analytical and administration support to both clients and the team.
Responsibilities:
Performs standard pension benefit calculations (retirements, terminations, etc.) in accordance with plan rules and legislative requirement
Assists in the preparation of year-end annual pension statement
Works with pension databases and Lifeworks internal software/systems
Receives and responds to routine plan enquiries and requests from clients
Takes direction from, and supports, senior team members
Attends internal training sessions to build knowledge of industry topics and trends
Assists with special projects, as required
Succeeding as a Bilingual Senior Pension Analyst will require the following core qualifications and skills
Post-secondary education (preferably in Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science)
Bilingualism (English and French) is mandatory
2+ years of Defined Benefit or Defined Contribution pension administration experience (completed retirement, termination and death calculations and experience with multi-employer pension plans)
Knowledge of Defined Benefit pension plans and provincial pension and tax legislation
Excellent analytical and mathematical skills
Exceptional client service with strong professional acumen
Excellent communication (oral and written) and organizational skills
Advance proficiency in MS Office Suite (Word, Outlook); expert proficiency in Excel
Dedicated team player, who demonstrates initiative and independence
CEBS or PPAC an asset
Where permitted by law, LifeWorks employees must be fully immunized to access a LifeWorks office or customer premises.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to
talentacquisitiononboarding@lifeworks.com
Fulfilling work that matters
LifeWorks is in the business of helping organizations help their people and in the process, we strive to elevate ours. We're always looking for talented professionals and strategic leaders looking to make a difference in the lives of the people we serve. We appreciate the interest of every applicant; however, we contact only those selected for an interview.
At LifeWorks, we are committed to putting our people first. Our priority is to optimize the health and productivity of our people. In light of COVID-19, our company continues to monitor the global situation and following local guidance in each of our communities to ensure the health and wellbeing of our employees. Safety is our highest priority, and while the goal is to ultimately return to the office, we are currently working remotely and are connecting with candidates through virtual interviews, recruitment events, and information sessions. We are excited to connect with you virtually, and look forward to receiving your application.

column2: Project Leader 2- Integration Specialist - Information Servi...
column7:
We currently have a Regular Full-time opportunity for a Project Leader 2- Integration Specialist in the Information Services department at our Bayview campus.
Hours of Work:
Weekday: Days; 8 hrs

Summary of Duties
Accountable and responsible for defining and achieving project mandates, objectives and deliverables through management of integration projects at Sunnybrook
Act as an integration resource to ancillary systems and departments throughout Sunnybrook
Establish standards for documentation across all applications and their interfaces and integrations
Establish policies and processes for new and existing integrations – both through the corporate interface engine; at the ancillary level and external
Establish and chair engagement of application stakeholders to maintain consistency and currency of integration methodologies, documentation, and architecture
Establish project governance and provide guidance within established channels for change and new implementations (CAB, ASRB)
Provide support and/or guidance for organization integrations with external organizations
Establish a central repository of knowledge of organization integrations, methodologies, and architecture
Ensure commitment of resources and other project requirements are met
Develops detailed work plans, schedules, project budget estimates, resource plans, terms of reference, charter and role/task definitions and status reports
Leads project team, which may consist of vendor, client and internal resources, to achieve project deliverables, monitor progress and challenges of projects
Adhere to project and change control procedures to manage project scope and PM/SDLC requirements for documentation, delivery, review and approvals
Identify and define system inter-dependencies and workflow (i.e. interfaces)
Work with teams to map specifications and assist with prototype designs
Define software functional and design requirements for the users and development team based on HL7 rules, analysis and system and database design
Coordinate and track the efforts of working groups, committees, development team and vendors. Work to keep projects on track so that they are completed within the agreed time parameters
Identify, resolve or escalate issues as raised with team members, users, and vendors
Ad hoc analysis, design, development, QA, implementation and support as required
Qualifications/Skills
University degree required in Health Sciences (Informatics preferred), Computer Science, Engineering, Business Administration, and/or related field.
Project Management Professional (PMP) certification or progression towards their PMP is an asset
Minimum 5 years of experience in a Project Manager and/or Senior Business Analyst role, with a minimum 2 years of experience leading projects with increasing complexity and scope is an asset.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Independent and self-directed in work style
Good knowledge of integration technologies and standards
Good knowledge of project management and applicable healthcare industry experience
Experience with information systems architectures in a health care setting is an asset
Experience with vendor and team relations with excellent presentation, communication, change management and technical writing skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize tasks and manage deadlines effectively
Analytical abilities and ability to work effectively with technical & business users
Ability to understand business requirements and convert them to functional specifications and create technical and functional documentation
Ability to work effectively with all levels of management
Experience with MS Office with proficiency in Excel, PowerPoint, Project and Visio
Good understanding of data and schema standards and concepts
Good understand database design, implementation, troubleshooting and maintenance
Qualified candidates are invited to submit their cover letter and resume (in one document) quoting 223433 to:
Human Resources
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre

Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is committed to providing accessible employment practices that are in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). If you require accommodation for disability during any stage of the recruitment process, please indicate this in your cover letter.
Sunnybrook Health Sciences Centre is strongly committed to inclusion and diversity within its community and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: visible minorities, all religions and ethnicities, persons with disabilities, LGBTQ persons, and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas.
Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Sunnybrook, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days ago. Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
